placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t go.
text:
What a waste of money. Overrated. 

I’ll start with the positives: 

-Rooms are nice and spacious, maybe a touch dated but overall solid quality. Outdoor pool is good but again pretty dated. 

-Food is awesome. Not the best we had in Sri Lanka but very solid cooking. 

Now the negatives:

-Safaris are laughable. This was supposed to be the highlight of the stay and the reason to go to Yala. Our guide was essentially useless - did not point things out, just sat in the car. Driving was erratic at best and dangerous at worst. We almost canceled the rest of our stay after the first night it was so bad. 

-Management was nowhere to be found. We brought up our negative safari experience to the front desk and asked to speak with a manager - this resulted in them sending over the safari guide who we proceeded to have a highly confrontational, uncomfortable, and awkward conversation with. 

-The wine list is comically bad. For an all-inclusive hotel priced at $1500+/night I expect better than $5/bottle wine. And even the options to purchase were limited / uninteresting. 

At the end of the day, there are FAR better resorts for FAR less $ in Sri Lanka. Shoutout to Haritha Villas & Spa in Hikkaduwa (for example). 

Uga Chena is way overhyped and incredibly overpriced. Most of the time we were saying things like “damn - I really wish this hotel was as good as their marketing.”
title: Waste of Money

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We visited Chena Huts with our 2 kids on Spring Break to have a short Safari experience. Though the overall trip to the hotel was good in terms of the game drives, the facilities and the food, we had serious concerns about the cleanliness and hygiene of the rooms.

I understand that we are in a National Park so there are lots of wild animals and it’s possible a small one can find it’s way into a room. However we did not expect that a rat would have made a home in our mini fridge.

We had to wake up at 5am for a game drive  and from midnight till 3am we were not able to sleep because we kept hearing plastic noises from the mini bar. What was later found to be the rat tugging away at the packet of complimentary cookies.

We had to call the reception and complain 5 times until they finally woke up some people and sent them to our room. After that the guys did not find anything so I told them I have seen the rat and it is probably inside the body of the fridge. Since it wasn’t going to come out itself I told them they might as well pick up the fridge and move it out of the room. As soon as they picked up the fridge the entire floor below it was covered with rat droppings.

The next morning housekeeping cleaned it up and replaced the fridge but surprisingly after this whole experience the manager said that we take your word for it because we didn’t find anything. They denied the whole experience that took place at night and covered it all up while we were on the game drive.

We spent the next 2 days fighting it out with the management and demanded a basic compensation of a 1 night refund since our first night out of only 2 nights was entirely ruined and we got no sleep at all. However they never owned up and took any action. Our agent continued to fight with them for 2 more weeks and they cold to be bothered.

It is a beautiful property but I would be seriously concerned about the hygiene levels. I can understand a raccoon or squirrel in the room but not a rat. The customer service of the management is far from 5 star despite the restaurant staff, chefs and facilities overall being amazing.
title: There was a rat in the room!!

text:
New resort in a great location just 100m from the beach, very quiet and good atmosphere
-Rooms: are well equipped and comfort design, but too dark and is a pity when nature outside is wonderful..!Try to avoid interior bungalows and choose facing the beach or lagoon. Must say that they help us to have a good location when we ask her. Poor snack amenities
-Spa: Not the best in Sri Lanka, was just ok, but was easy to book even with rains
-Restaurant: Only one, and not integrated in such a beautiful place, windows all around feeling like you are in a jail, and you have to ask to dinner or breakfast outside in the terrace. My advise: They can put some big sunshades to enjoy more the terrace-beach even if rains because it worth
-Food: dinner food and wine was very good all the time. But not for breakfast where food was medium 
-Staff: very friendly and helpful but the manager should do more efforts to put more happiness in the air, including herself
-Safari: good vehicles with snacks and drinks and good driver and guide (Janick if I'm not bad...) but in my opinion Yala is not the place to do Safaris. You can find 75% more animals in Kenia or Southafrica, but I have to add that place is amazing (but plenty of jeeps) :(

I recommend this resort if you want to enjoy a calm holiday just walking around, doing spa/pool/sun, spot birds or just expecting to be lucky during the safari tour... otherwise no
title: Could be better

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Uga Chena Huts for two nights, which was a good amount of time. The safari experience was amazing and the ranger we had was very talented and we were able to see leopards, elephants and a bear. All the staff were super friendly.

However our $US1,200 per night all inclusive accommodation and food/drinks package at Chena Huts was disappointing. They offered one red wine which was a local Sri Lankan pinot noir, and one gin which was a local Sri Lankan gin. For $US1,200 per night we expected to have a choice and to definitely not just be offered local wine and spirits.

The food was average and not 'fine dining' at all like described on the website.

The website also made out like you would be enjoying the outdoors and the beach however we were told on arrival that we were not to walk or swim at the beach and were to remain in the dining room, pool or in our hut at all times. When we did sit on the verandah out the back of our huts, we were so accosted by bugs that we had to move back inside after a few minutes. This meant that outside of safaris, we were sitting inside our hut which was not what we had imagined when we saw the website.

The huts were also not what we expected. They were nice however were all artificial - the palm leaf roof was made out of fake plastic palm leaves, the timber decking was made our of fake plastic timber. It was strange.
title: No beach access, very limited wine and spirits list, average food.

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ask for a room facing the beach
text:
We wanted to like Chena Huts after spending $1200/night & because you can tell the staff truly wanted us to enjoy our stay. I hesitate to write this review & I do not want to be mean, but I just think other travelers need to be warned before they spend this kind of money. 

Room/Resort: This was a huge positive! This was probably one of the nicest hotel rooms we've stayed in. Extremely comfortable bed, beautiful furnishings, well laid out. Our backyard was a bit of a disappointment compared to the pictures (and other rooms). It was very large but full of crab grass (rather than full decking) and open. Considering there were only 1-2 other rooms booked during our 2-night stay, I'm not sure why they didn't put us in an ocean facing room with the nice decks, but oh well. We were told that we could not go to the beach without an escort because it was dangerous with animals. This made it so that you were really confined to your room outside of game drives & we got a little stir crazy. I went on an beach walk with a ranger once and wasn't quite sure why I could walk on my own - there were several people from Cinnamon Yala on their own, the ranger wasn't carrying a weapon to protect us & he didn't exactly instill confidence. I think the resort should reconsider this policy and maybe advise guests what to do if they did encounter an animal (especially since that it's possible for them to be near the rooms if they're at the beach).

Safari/Guides: The positive: We saw leopards, sloth bear, 1 elephant, lots of crocodiles, a crocodile kill a bird, lots of pretty birds & other small animals.  I know it is unfair to compare to South Africa safaris (except that they are charging SA prices!), and I know that Chena Huts can't control what others do/don't do in the national park, so I will refrain from judging them on this. We had 2 different safari rangers on the 3 game drives & 1 beach walk we went on. Our first ranger had 8 months experience and our 2nd had 2 weeks experience, both coming to Chena Huts after doing elephant research.  While they were both nice, it was obvious they had no experience or training in being a guide/ranger.  We had to ask our first ranger bird & animal names and he hardly spoke unless we asked questions. The 2nd ranger spoke more but was so busy taking pictures and was so excited to see the animals that he seemed to forget we were there. On several occasions we had to ask him to have the driver move the vehicle forward so we weren't blocked by a tree while he was getting perfect views/pictures of the elephant.  I actually truly appreciated his excitement to see the animals after our first guide just seemed to be along for the speedy ride, but it would have been great if he could have spoken more about the animals, their habits, predators, food sources, etc.  Although he was making kissing noises at the animals to make them turn towards his camera, so maybe he didn't know much about the animals? The guides were nice but just seemed so uncomfortable talking to us. Another couple that was on our drive felt the same way and called out our driver a few times for taking pictures and not talking to us. 

Food - The food in general was just ok and far from expectations of such an expensive place. The first day the chef came out to greet us and said just let him know if we'd like anything special or off menu - he could make us anything. At lunch, my husband requested a chicken sandwich and they said they didn't have bread. He then asked for a wrap (there was a veggie wrap on the menu), so they made a chicken wrap but left the bones in it. I had the veggie wrap and it was very greasy and not so great. Our first night the staff excitedly informed us that they had a special Beach BBQ planned for us (and the only 2 other rooms booked that night). They had cooked a ton of meat and fish on the grill but hadn't thought to ask what anyone wanted, allergies or food preferences. Every other remote/all-inclusive place we've ever stayed has asked for this information in advance - especially when they are cooking for only 6 people - to not waste food & options are limited.  When I turned down the seafood, they became very concerned and asked if I didn't eat fish. I said no & they said they were so sorry. When the meat came around, I took some chicken just to have something on my plate. Several staff came over to express their concern and the chef offered to cook me some pasta. I declined because I wasn't that hungry and they were so upset that I just wanted to tell them everything was ok so they would feel better and stop asking - which in hind sight is stupid because now I'm complaining. This whole situation could have been avoided if they just asked guests before or on arrival.  My husband who does eat meat/seafood said the BBQ wasn't very good.  We didn't eat the 2nd night because my husband was sick, so I can't say if their actual dinner menu was veggie friendly or good. 

Staff/Coordination: As I've mentioned, the staff was very friendly and wanted us to enjoy our stay but they just weren't trained. Since there were only 1-2 other rooms during our stay, we were often the only ones in the dining room/"lobby".  They would all come up and ask how everything was but it was just a little too much because they didn't have anyone else to wait on. Also, there was no coordination among the staff. We went on our morning game drive (we were the only ones that went that day), ate breakfast and headed back to our room to find 4 people cleaning our room (and sitting on our bed) so we had to wait. If they were fully booked, I would let it pass. But they only had to clean 2 rooms that day and had 4-5 hours to do it while we were on a hotel arranged safari and breakfast. There were a few other examples of lack of coordination as well but you get the point. The staff was concerned when they learned my husband was sick and asked if they could bring food to the room since we didn't want to go to dinner - we declined but the offer was thoughtful. The next day several staff members asked if he was better, which was nice. They could have asked if he needed a doctor, medicine or help in any other way but didn't - and he was fine, just what you would expect of a luxury hotel. To summarize, it's a lot of asking if everything is ok but lacking the tools to fix it, so you just tell them it's ok so they'll stop asking. 

We did appreciate the warm welcome and goodbye from the staff and manager and that they truly want to be a good resort. They just aren't there & I hope this review can help them. I think this would be more accurately priced under $400/night and would still need to make improvements. We stayed at a range of hotels during our 11 nights in Sri Lanka +4 nights at Coco Island Maldives, with Chena Huts being the most expensive in Sri Lanka. Chena Huts was the only disappointing stay out of the 6 places we stayed.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a lovely property.  The setting is beautiful and the small public room and the bedrooms are all very pretty.  We have stayed in the top hotels all over the world so I write this review from a point of comparative reference.  We picked this hotel personally despite the opinion of our travel agent.

The service was poor.  The management failed to coordinate any of the events that are promised as activities of the hotel.  Cooking class was scheduled and then “canceled” without any communication by the manager.  The nature keep ride let 45 minutes past its scheduled time again without any apology or notice.  The bartender was not available during cocktail time; he was on a break on it took 30 minutes to get a drink.  There was no one to greet us upon our arrival and we carried our bags to our driver ourselves as we departed. Incorrect information was given us on the day of departure about whether or not the train was running.  The manager allowed children to simply bang on the piano for much of our first day stay during our time in the public space until we asked him to address the issue.

The management was quite verbal about how great they were but we failed to see any of the performance that they so  proclaimed.

This is a shame because the property has so much to offer.  

As the reader you might wander why then, the property has gotten so many positive reviews.  I think our experience was similar to the few poor reviews.  I am not sure why there are so many good ones.

I would definitely look for an alternative property in the Kandy area.
title: Potential but disappointing

text:
I had the worst experience in my life as we waited 3 and half hours in reception while the hotel staff and my online travel agent sorted out a booking error. The hotel reservation team wasn't sure about various online travel agencies that sell their rooms and I had to explain them and show them that Cancelon is a valid site and they have been selling the Ulagalla rooms. Cencelon handled the situation very well and they assured me that they will do everything to correct the situation and paid extra as the hotel took advantage of the situation and charged Cancelon more than what the local rate that hotel has offered me. I have wrote to the hotel management regarding their unethical practice two days back but didn't get any response as of yet.

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Let me start with the price.  It's US$700 a night for DB&B, and the comments below reflect the expectations for a hotel in that price bracket.

Starting with the good points:
1. The grounds are beautiful.  The gardens are well maintained, filled with lovely plants and wildlife.  Most of the grounds are paddy fields with rice growing, along with woodlands.  It is all very beautiful.
2.  The swimming pool is stunning, large, barely used, and very clean.
3.  The rooms are large, well equipped, and with a very comfortable bed.

The not so good points:
1.  Access from the main road is down a 2km dirt track, much of which is heavily rutted.  It is 15 minutes of very slow progress.  I don't understand why the hotel, whose residents must provide much of the traffic, don't do something about it.
2.  The lighting in the rooms is abysmal.  It is all very well being green, but lighting should actually be sufficient to see properly.  Black lampshades don't help.
3.  To compound matters, the lights are controlled by a bedside 'computer', which is most unintuitive.  And why do lights in the lounge have to be controlled from the bedside?  The designer could not have found a more effective method for annoying guests.
4.  The air conditioning is too noisy to be used at night.  This is unacceptable when night time temperatures are a minimum of 25C and you can't have windows open because of the risk of animals and bugs.
5.  Service in the restaurant is variable at best.  You will struggle to get through breakfast in 45 minutes even when you have said you are in a hurry.  There are plenty of staff but little action.  My pancakes the first day were stone cold, and the coffee undrinkable.

With the exception of the group's head chef who happened to be on site whilst we were there, and came to speak with us after our complaint about the cold breakfast, we cannot think of a single member of staff who seemed genuinely interested in ensuring our stay was comfortable.  The gardeners seemed the most genuine.

With a bit more attention to detail, and a significant upgrade to staff training, this could be a fantastic hotel, well worth the very high price being charged.  Sadly right now, you just feel you are a revenue stream for the owners.
title: This place could be so good

text:
This was my first trip to Sri Lanka and this was the first hotel I stayed in. It sets the bar so high.....
The environment is beautiful and so calm - during the day you get the impression you're the only guest in the hotel. Only at night at the superb restaurant and bar do you finally realise there are other guests staying. The food is stunning - particularly if you like the traditional 'rice & curry', which is cooked and presented in such a wonderful way. There are many other dishes to try, all of which are superb.
The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. It was a perfect start to my holiday, and I really think those 'tourists' who gave negative reviews of this establishment should never have come to Sri Lanka in the first place....

BUT....be aware that they take a credit card deposit of 10,000 rupees on checking in, and that is NOT deducted from your final bill. The refund (as long as you notice it on your credit card statement and ask for it) should be made in 14 days - I'm still waiting for mine!
title: Fabulous, but beware...

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: bring your mosquito net
text: Booked through agoda but mistakenly for one instead of 2, difference was $39 for an extra person on web-site, but on check out was charged an extra $300 for 2 nights! Firstly this location is in the middle of nowhere, but is listed as in Anuradhpura. Cost of taxi from Anuradhapura railway station is less than $20 at station or $50 if you book from hotel, taxis reluctant to go there because road is in very bad condition with loads of construction work along way. Location has many ponds and lakes, but resort fails to provide mosquito netting over bed which should be standard for hotels in potential malaria and dengue areas such as this. So need to bring loads of deet and your own mosquito net (which we luckily did). Not much to do in this remote location, kayaking, horse riding, archery, cycle tours are all charged  at crazy prices. Ended up arranging our own transportation to leave hotel. OK if you want to pay over central London 5 star hotel prices.
title: Pretentious rip off

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
We (a family of 5) reserved 2 rooms at Ulagalla resorts for a total of 2600 USD 5 months in advance to ensure us of a 4-night new year highlight in our three week vacation tour around Sri Lanka. When arriving at the site, we first had to negotiate for about 15 minutes outside of the security gate to be allowed to enter. Once in, it quickly showed out that Ulagalla resorts claimed that they did not have a reservation for us.
After several phone calls with Hotels.com customer service - who behaved professionally - nothing much changed more than that the seniority of the person meeting us became higher and higher. We interfaced with the general manager and eventually with his manager.
No action was taken other than explaining to us - again and again - that we did not have a reservation and that the fault must have been on Hotels.com's side. We spent more than 2 hours waiting, not coming any further.
Eventually, the general manager told us that he could transfer us to another hotel 45 minutes away and that we could return for our last three nights. He, however, claimed that we should pay for these night even though we had done that payment already 5 months earlier. Realising that we would now end up paying twice, having a yet bigger exposure to risk, we told the general manager that unless he was capable of ensuring (by speaking to Hotels.com) that we did not have to pay twice, we could not stay.
He - the general manager (!) - then behaved irrationally and emotionally explaining to us that he did not anyhow think we would be the "right people for his place". It was an insult up our face. He said that to a deeply tired family with three kids, having travelled 4 hours to get to his hotel and having had to wait two hours without being provided with any food.
When we wanted to leave, the general manager's manager excused himself, but not more than that he did not pay the transportation out of his hotel. On the contrary, he told us the price and asked us to pay.
Conclusion: The true nature of this place - looking great on surface - showed when the management came under pressure. I am sure the management will comment to this below, but please trust us and contact me if you want further detail.
title: Avoid, avoid, avoid!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: In terms of location, this has to be one of the great hotels of the world but the service is hopeless and the food moderate. The hotel has been open about 6 months but as yet the management have not even started to get to grips with the problems. I'm not even sure that they realise that they have problems.

But we cannot bargain on rates even though you threatened to post a negative review, as you have done. Your lunch and wine was with our compliments despite the fact you didn't stay with us. placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
I was so excited for my stay at the Tea Trails, but it all came falling down once I got there. 

First of all, they are not flexible with rates for people who travel alone - all their rates are for pairs. So you end up paying the all-inclusive cost of a second person. 

And next to that, once you have convinced yourself you are willing to pay that amount of money (which is a crazy amount for Sri Lankan standards). The food turns out to be average, wine ok and management super rude. 

I ended up packing my bags and leaving, to a guest house in Hatton. Lovely people, amazing food, great room, super polite, literally in the middle of tea fields and all for $20 per night. 

So Tea Trails; the accommodation is nice, the views are stunning and the food is ok. But it is absolutely not worth the rates their charging.
title: Not "Single Traveler Proof" and did not meet expectations.

ownerResponse/text: I can understand how you feel after such a long journey to the usual solitude of Tea Trails. This was an unusual situation and we attempted to resolve the matter whilst you were in residence. The butler has been spoken to, this again is an uncharacteristic incident and I'm very sorry that it marred your stay.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Even the smallest room is of generous proportion.  Check if there is festival going on is more important.
text:
On arrival Norwood Bungalow, we noticed the loud Bollywood music.  When we mentioned this to the butler, he said "We don't even understand what they are singing about."  and quickly walked away.   We asked other staff and learnt that there're four festivals in a year at the nearby Hindu temple.  We travelled around 12 hours from Sydney to Colombo plus 4 hrs in transit and another 4.5 hrs to Norwood.  We didn't expect to be bombarded with this loud, non-stop Bollywood music day and night in the middle of tea plantation on our vacation. We thought it would be switched off at night.  When we got up 2 am, the music was still on in the same volume.  We did see they moved people to the other bungalow who asked discount for the disturbance.  We were left there to "enjoy" the music.  We had to chase the head office on this matter and finally got partial refund for the disturbance.

On arrival, we inquired about the tea factory tour.  The butler said "There is a festival going on.  I have to call and check if the tour is still on."  He never got back to us.  We thought he had arranged it for us.  No.  He presumed that we were not interested because my husband mentioned he knew the process. 

He said twice that he would leave the registration form on our desk.  But that form had never appeared on our desk.

At dinner, the butler came to us for the next day's activity.  I asked "Is it possible to walk to the other bungalow?"  He replied "8, 12, 16km, which one do you want to go?"  It's a bit daunting for 12 and 16km, so I chose the 8km one. He said "I will give you a map."  He walked away immediately.

The following morning after breakfast, we realized he didn't even book the tea factory tour for us.  We asked him if we can go to the nearby tea factory.  "Oh, yes, tell them you are guests from the bungalow, so you can look around the factory."  We did go there as he told us.  No, the factory is not open to the public.

It seemed to us that there's only this butler in charge at the bungalow.  I was not happy, so I sent an email to their head office to complain.  

During lunch, an assistant manager suddenly appeared and quickly arranged a private tea factory tour for us.  After my complaint, the butler confirmed with us that we would be chauffeured to the other bungalow back and forth.  We were being gradually upgraded from being given a map to walk there at dinner, to one way car offered after breakfast,  then to round-trip car confirmed at lunch.

In our less than 24 hr and 4 brief encounters with this particular butler, it didn't take long to prove he was unable to fulfill his words and gave us very misleading information. When we were ferried to Dunkeld later on and saw the road condition with all the ups and downs and twists and turns and traffic condition, we felt it's more like a 16km walk rather than a flat 8 km walk. What was he thinking?  

The one star we rated is based on the noise and the butler.
We will give the rest of the staff five stars.

Our suggestions:
For top end accommodation:  Go to Amanwella and Amangalla, no one behaves like this butler.  We were treated as equal just like all other guests.  Their general managers are very accessible.

For scenery, Ella rock looks spectacular.  Norwood is not that great.  

For "walkable walk", take the car up to Lipton seat and walk down to Dambatenne tea factory.  It is picturesque with stone walls, tea plantation dotted with boulders, unspoiled mountains, and few traffic.
title: Marred by the noise and an unpleasant butler

ownerResponse/text: Dear JFT, concerned to read your review, I will look into the points you make and respond in detail. I'm extremely sorry that Tea Trails Norwood Bungalow fell short of your expectations.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: We have just returned from spending 2 wonderful weeks travelling around Sri Lanka, staying in 7 different places, and overall the experience way exceeded our expectations in terms of accommodation, food, scenery and the people and culture. Our biggest disappointment by far, however, was Norwood Cottage of Ceylon Tea Trails; surprising, really, as this was also by far the most expensive property we stayed at. Our immediate impression on entering the grounds and then the house is that it is tired and dated, and in need of refurbishment and attention to detail. Stained upholstery, worn rugs, mismatching and dated furniture and fittings, untrimmed lawns and hedges, and uncleaned outdoor furniture is not what we expected in a property of this calibre. The bedroom lacked ambience and character, particularly at night with bright lighting. One of the redeeming features of the bungalow is the large dining and living room, with its vaulted timber ceiling, large stone fireplace, and walls of glass and french doors opening onto the alfresco patio, where breakfast and lunches are served overlooking the gardens, valley and mountains. The picturesque setting is the other redeeming feature. Meals were on the whole disappointing and not what we had expected in a Relaix & Chateaux establishment - the 4 course dinner advertised on the website turned out to be a fairly ordinary Sri Lankan curry followed by dessert, which equates to 2 courses to our thinking. The final letdown was that we were not served tea in bed in the morning, as promised on the website, although we did hear the "butlers" knocking on some of the other guests' doors, so presumably some of them did get tea in bed. In the morning I wanted to read my book out in our courtyard, however our table and chairs were wet from rain the previous evening, and covered in leaves, so I abandoned this idea.  I then moved to the pool area with the same idea in mind, only to find that these too were wet; I would have expected that in an establishment of this calibre the outdoor furniture would be cleaned and wiped down regularly for guests to use at any time. We left Norwood feeling disappointed and somewhat angry - it did not come remotely close to meeting our expectations, and we would not recommend this place to anyone! Don't waste your money, there are plenty of other cheaper and much nicer places to stay in Sri Lanka.
title: Norwood Bungalow - our biggest disappointment in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text: Whilst thanking you for your comments on your stay at Castlereagh, please accept my sincere apologies for the issue at Norwood. The new dining area wasn’t adequately shielded from your room. As we were full we could not offer a change of rooms. Measures have been taken to create a small private enclosed garden in front of both the rooms that face this area and this will address the issue. We are also redecorating the room. I am very sorry for the disturbance caused.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
NORWOOD
Our two-day stay at Norwood was in stark contrast to the sublime luxury offered 
by the sister  property Castlereagh (see below). Our room (Jeffry) was a disgrace for a property of this status. It was small, user-unfriendly and with a bathroom little more than a narrow corridor (one had to take it in turn to use it). If this was not enough, the room and bathroom were severely overlooked from the new restaurant and potentially from waiting staff and other guests, who had to walk past the window. When we arrived there was not even a net curtain in situ! The room's proximity to the restuarant, meant that from 05.20 each morning sleep was wishful thinking. The final straw came when we realised there was neither AC or a ceiling fan and that the floor fan was worn out and so noisy it was quite impossible to use. Although we asked for a replacement, we were informed it was not possible. We left tired and disgruntled after 2 sleepless nights and spending a lot of money.. If you choose to stay here, do not book a room without knowing its location - there are two like ours.
CASTLEREAGH ***** 
Brilliant ambiance, excellent service and food. Our two-day stay in a suite in Castlereagh Bungalow more than met our expectations of the luxury and attentive service of a fine Relais et 
Chateau property. The bungalow was well managed and the cuisine excellent. The lakeside location (from where there are some interesting walks), provides a tranquil, yet scenic location. Thoroughly recommended.
Service  *****
Value    *****
Sleep Quality ****
Cleanliness  ****
Location  *****
Rooms  *****
title: Norwood Bungalow - Poor impractical room, stunning situation

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your kind comments on Tea Trails’s location and the staff. We have not had complaints of poor maintenance before but have arranged a complete deep clean of your room. My sincere apologies. The bungalows have been busy and we will be refurbishing in the low season. As for food, being in a remote location, we need to bring provisions in but we do so carefully. The head chef travels to the fishing village of Negombo twice weekly and brings back seafood which is then portioned and refrigerated. We haven’t had prior complaints of freshness but will ensure that Sri Lankan cuisine is always available to those who prefer it. Thanks again for your feedback.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in the Baker room at Castlereigh.Having read visitor's reviews,the Tea Trails literature and saw the Relais logo our expectations were high.First the good news;The property has a fantastic position with fabulous views,a beautiful garden and lovely clean infinity pool.The staff was generally pleasant and eager to please although we felt that to some extent we were being "processed".This may be due to the high turnover of guests since we believe most are new and only there for a night or two. Now the disappointing part;What we didn't appreciate was that we will be staying in what we recognized to be a British 60's style bungalow that was now somewhat tired and ready for a significant makeover.We were reluctant to use a bathtub/shower with a curtain that at least to us smelled of mildew,grout that confirmed mold and similarly afflicted caulking.In our bedroom their were stains on the ceiling complemented by cobwebs and dust on the windows and poorly painted woodwork.We may simply have been unlucky.When it comes to meals however,we felt truly mislead by the impression given that a chef was on hand to prepare high quality meals to please every guest.In fact,given the remote location of the property and the small number of rooms ,it is clear to us now that,when offered,such variety came at the expense of freshness.Based on our experience we would recommend sticking to Sri Lankan food which was wasn't always on offer but was very good.
We discussed our concerns with management who appeared to appreciate the feedback.Hopefully refurbishment will take place(the season ends very soon) and Sri Lankan cuisine, based on fresh seasonal local ingredients ,will feature more prominently.
title: Stunning views,beautiful grounds,shame about the rest

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. We have 3 categories of rooms as explained on the website – Luxury Rooms, Garden Suites and Master Suites. Apparently your travel agent had mistakenly shown you a photo of a Garden Suite although you had been booked into a Luxury Room. We apologise for your disappointment although our Luxury Rooms are spacious and well received. Traditional tea planters’ bungalows don’t have air conditioning and only ceiling fans, as the climate is generally cool. 5 Star type categorisations apply to conventional hotels, which we strive not to be! As the tea estates were not working due to the Thai Pongal harvest festival we offered a complimentary trek and bird watching walk with our activities manager. Guided Activities are priced in US$ as that is easier to understand for most guests and the same currency as the room rates. Once again I apologise for not meeting your expectations.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Insist on a "Garden Room" - a luxury room is a basic room -as we found to our cost. (We left a day early)
text:
These properties are marketed as five star properties and are priced accordingly. Travellers should beware, however, as not all the rooms are any where near 5 star standard. We were allocated a room at the back of Tientsin Bungalow, next to the kitchen, with no view and poor natural light. There was no AC , so even in this Hill Country location the room was hot at night.We had been allocated a "luxury" room on our Trail Finders Itinerary but the manager explained that a "luxury" room was actually their basic room! We found this cocept hard to grasp.
We also arrived at the Tea Estate during a 3 day holiday so there was no tea picking evident and the factory was not working so could not be visited. The administration did not make any alternative arrangements for activities until we spoke to the manager. In general add-on activities were expensive and priced in US Dollars - always an indicator of an over priced item in these regions.
title: Tea Trails Bungalows- Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: We have just spent the last two nights in the Tate room, it's really noisy due to being next to the lounge area, guests will be in the lounge until 1pm drinking, don't think you will get any sleep.  I had to request to the other guests to lower the noise while I stood there in my dressing gown, as the staff would not do this!! Also the light in the  hallway shines into the room. Don't eat at the table nearest the lake as the crows will eat your food off the table while you are eating. If you are staying there get a suite to get away from the noise. The food and the surroundings are great. I would also recommend the tea factory tour.
title: Tea trails Castlereigh Bungalow

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We truly appreciate your kind words about the food, the staff and setting. We are rather devastated however with your criticism of the furniture. These are the original tea planters bungalows, which have been sympathetically restored. Much of the furniture was used by the planters who lived there. I do accept they are not top-notch antiques as these were “working bungalows” but to compare the bungalow to a 2 star lodging is rather unkind. We will fix the issue with the mosquito coils, thank you for pointing out.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Without some improvement, this should not be part of Relais and Chateaux (which we often visit around the world).  This place could be fantastic, and shame on the owners for their short sightedness.  My wife and I had the Master Bedroom for three nights (and this was supossedly their best room).  The website photos of the interior are not reflective of the poor quality, chipped furnishings, and flea market quality decor.

My wife and I travel about a third of the year on busines and pleasure, and try to be balanced in reviews, given the standards of differing contries and cultures.  We spent three nights in the master suite at Summerville - This house had cracked tiles,  in the bathroom which desperately needed re-grouting, cheap furniture which was not "antique" by any measure, and the whole inside felt as if it needed a huge remodel (not to change the period feel, but rather to bring it up above the standard of a two star lodging).  The cabinets smelled of moth balls, as if the home belonged to an elderly relative who had lost their sense of smell, and cleanliness. The various brick a brack were not quaint, simply cheap, as if they were afraid the guest might walk off with anything of value.  One other couple from Hong Kong who visited concurrent with us suggested that they felt like they were visiting a "Brady Bunch House" (a bad american sitcom set in a home with tacky cheap furniture).  The rooms simply lacked class, which is not only expected, but demanded in this price range (I believe their prices are fair; provided they remodel the interiors with decent period furniture, new curtains and other items that do not make you cringe).

This appalling attention to the interiors and furnishings is especially shortsighted, when even as a foriegner, we could purchase top quality period peices around Galle for next to nothing (and authentic looking reproductions were even less expensive)

Here are the good and the bad:

Good:  
1. Staff.  The staff was top notch, and the cooking perfection.  The chef made not only delightful food, but an artistic display of each meal.  The fact that the chef would speak to us each day and    find out what we most wanted, and what our needs were (he made a few special soups for my wife which were wonderful! - if we could hire hime for our home, we would do so.

The other staff were very standoffish initially.  But my wife and I found that once we smiled and laughed with them a bit, they warmed up, and became delightful - I think that they feared they would make a mistake setting silverware, or pouring from the wrong side... and when they realized that this was unimportant to us, and we were more interested in learning about them and their families and life, they became their wonderful selves.  

2.  Setting. This is one of the most beautiful settings in the world - and I think most of the good reviews really come from the feel you get when you step outside and take in the beautiful lake and rows and rows of mountainous tea plants.  My wife and I hiked up the hills on our own, intentionally getting a bit lost (and made our way into a wonderful small village where we laughed with the local children and their mothers..... though we did not speak the local language, smiles were all that was needed for a kind exchange of cultures).  We had expected the Tea pickers to be treated poorly based on western articles, and that seemed far from the case, with their health and educational needs taken care of, and their huts, although small, were clean and clearly a good home (ironically most with satallite dishes- which we see more and more in the most remote places).  

Bad:  The buildilng, the cheap furniture, the smelly mothball scent and feel.  The ridiculous bookshelf which they called a library in the main room (looked like IKEA with about 3 overused board games, and no selection of books other than what you would find in a cheap youth hostel).

The Pool:  The pool is beautiful, stunning overlooking the lake, but was not heated.. so what's the point, except to take a photo?

Insects:  We have ventured into the deepest jungles of Africa and Cambodia, among others, so we expect insects of all sorts (some are amazingly beautiful and we saw a few fireflies (and we love geckos which feed of the insects).... but we also expect at least where the rooms and dining areas are to have a level of mosquito coils or other assistance so that you can sit a bit without becoming the main course.  Each of the guest kept asking for mosquito coils, but the limited number kept going out... surely this is easily solved and a constant refrain, so why not fix it?  We had brought sprays, as had the other guest, but these were obviously a hardy strain and didn't seem to be affected.....  We don't expect or want a place to be insect free, but a reduction, certainly around the eating areas is deserved.

Our recommendation is to hope they either improve, or are forced by competition to get their act together, as this beautiful area should not be missed during a Sri Lanka visit.
title: Perfect Setting - Smelly Unkempt Building With Tacky Furniture

ownerResponse/text:
I am sorry that you found Tea Trails offered poor value and didn't like the furniture.

Your comments about airline style food are unfair.  We don't have menus and initially ask what type of main course you would prefer. English language limitations prevent a London restaurant style description by the respective bungalow chefs.

Per our records, this was your first dinner menu: Baby beetroot salad with orange & pine nuts, spicy berry tea vinaigrette, Carrot & coriander Soup, Sirloin steak, gratin potato with vegetables, Tiramisu.

Afternoon tea comprised Scones, Lemon curd tarts, 2 varieties of Cakes, Finger sandwiches, single estate teas from the neighbouring estates.

Once again, I am sorry your expectations were dashed.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
The idea of several bungalows in the tea fields of Sri Lanka is fascinating. Even better the fact that you can walk from one to the other, having lunch in one place and then tea in another. The problems is that all the bungalows need updating. Furnishing are of mediocre quality and not the antiques promised in the description of the place. Food is totally standard (we were asked if we wanted beef,fish or chicken for dinner: it sounds like a choice you have on airplane...). Even the high tea is not of high quality. Service is good and the people working there couldn't be nicer!!!
But they build up high expectations and reality is that they do not deliver!!!!
title: Poor value for money.

ownerResponse/text:
Whilst apologising for not meeting your expectations, I have to take exception to your review. We had an inquiry into your several allegations below:

THE SERVICE WAS PATCHY, THE BUTLER WE HAD SEEMED VERY UNINTERESTED AND UNHELPFUL I FELT A BURDEN ASKING HIM FOR ANYTHING:

You handed the butler 30 items for laundry the day you arrived, he said he would send it to the main laundry at Norwood Bungalow and have it returned the next day. You said you needed them the same day. So we had 2 staff and the manager himself ironing your clothes and returned them as requested, when you handed over 43 more items, which we again readily accepted. I believe this indicates the level of service we offer, as consistently attested by other reviews.

The manager gave you his personal laptop to use when the desktop computer in the manager room was being used by another guest. We offer free wi-fi throughout the bungalows.

NO MENTION WAS MADE OF OUR HONEYMOON WHEN WE ARRIVED OR AT ANYTIME DURING OUR STAY

On 11th August we offered you a special 5 course alfresco candlelit dinner to celebrate your honeymoon. You said that you were tired and would like to have it the next day. Due to inclement weather, we served you the special honeymoon dinner indoors on 12th August.

WE WERE CRAMMED INTO A SMALL ROOM
You booked online for 2 adults and 2 children [not 1 child as you say above] into a twin bedded room. Room sizes and bed types are indicated when booking and the Jamieson luxury room you booked was shown as 40sqm. We alerted you by email that only one additional bed could be provided although you were bringing 2 children. We did suggest a larger Garden Suite, which you did not want to take. 

I am sorry that we have to respond in such detail but it is important that other potential guests are not misled. Tea Trails is popular amongst travelers looking for an unique experience and August is a busy month, but we do not drop our service standards when operating at full capacity. 

We have started planning our 5th bungalow to provide a 30% capacity expansion.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
we recently stayed at castlereagh bungalow as part of our 3 week honeymoon with our daughter in Sri Lanka.During this time we stayed in 6 different hotels in Sri lanka so feel we have a good idea on whats available in Sri Lanka. Tea Trails  is not a true reflection of Sri Lanka, the staff were not friendly and we left really disapointed.

 The service was very patchy a couple of the staff were good including Christo but others including the manager were unfriendly. The butler service is a con, the butler we had seemed very uninterested and unhelpful I felt a burden asking him for anything.
I had high expectations of Tea trails after all the postive reviews on TA and the high cost per night. We left feeling extremely disapointed with our stay.
We were crammed into a small room Jamieson its far too small for more than 2 people and shouldnt be sold for anymore than 2 people which was very disapointing when we paying $600+ per night!!
We were told Tea Trails is operating at almost 100% capacity and perhaps this is effecting the standards? 
 I didnt feel at all welcome staying there. no mention was made of our honeymoon when we arrived or at anytime during our stay even though I had sent an email reminder prior to our arrival.When reading the guest book most guests seemed to be on honeymoon so you if are thinking og going for your honeymoon and of being made to feel special at this time think again.
I noted most of the guests were quite stuffy aged 60 plus so maybe if you fit into this category you'll enjoy it but we didnt.

,the positives
 Castlereagh is situated in a beautiful location right on the reserviour
the food was very nice but not worth high cost .
title: Very disapointing

ownerResponse/text: Extremely sorry we did not meet your expectations. Guests who have stayed at Tientsin bungalow have posted very positive reviews after staying 2-3 days. It is not possible to fully appreciate what Tea Trails and Tientsin bungalow is about in the 45 minutes you spent there. Each of the 4 Tea Trails bungalows is different - Tientsin is the most traditional colonial which does mean dark teak floors and wooden panelling. This is part of its charm which makes it the favorite bungalow for many repeat guests. There are images of the bungalow exterior and interior on the Tea Trails website which accurately portray what you get - it is far from "shabby" as you claim.  The English style gardens first laid out around 1900 have stone walls and hedges, yes, in fact they are the prettiest of the Tea Trails gardens, in a valley surrounded by tea carpeted mountain vistas. As for the rates, they are all inclusive with gourmet meals, all drinks including spirits/wines, laundry which you did not stay long enough to experience. All taxes are included. Our "full board plus" rates offer better value than room only or B&B accommodation elsewhere. Please accept my apologies that we disappointed you. I do find your comments puzzling though and would welcome an opportunity to discuss further.
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a reservation at Tea Trails for the Tientsin house.  My expectations were pretty high since so many reviews were positive.  After driving through the beautiful highlands, we drove very far out of the way to arrive at Tientsin.  We were disappointed from the moment we got out of the car.  The Tientsin house did not capitalize on their view.  There were hedges and walls around so that you couldn't see very much around you.  When we walked in, it was very dark and pretty depressing.  We were asked to sit in the lounge where the furniture, rug, decor, etc. was very shabby.  I understand they are going for an older colonial look but it could have been done better.  It looked like a grandmother's old worn out country house.  The staff were very nice and the room was pretty nice but nothing spectacular for 415 USD per night between the two of us.  The price was outrageous.  We stayed at places for 50 USD that were almost the same level.  We only stayed for a few minutes and walked out because we were so disappointed.  For a whole lot less, you can get something with much better views, not so far out of the way, and in a prettier part of the highlands.  I'm shocked people pay that much to stay there.
title: Not worth it at all

text:
We spent the last night of our honeymoon here and had a horrible experience.  We booked our stay 9 months ago, then were harassed by the hotel staff throughout our honeymoon about needing payment prior to arrival.  After extensive back & forth over email and phone (while we were at a resort in the Maldives) the staff finally confirmed they had received our payment. text: If you want to show up at a giant timeshare like resort, eat buffets, do canned activities, pay $150 or more for a massage and be told it is unsafe to go in the ocean at your resort this is your place! If you want a reasonably   priced beach location where you can actually swim in the sundown ocean and not a swimming pool then don’t come here. title: Disappointment

text:
We stayed at Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle for 4 nights in a Beach Pool Villa to celebrate our anniversary, a religious festival with our 10-month-old baby. We flew all the way from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia specifically to stay at this resort, drawn in by the brand's reputation and the villa's advertised features.

Unfortunately, our experience was deeply disappointing — and not what you'd expect from a resort charging ~$1,000 per night.

Misleading Ocean View: The villa was promoted as having a direct ocean view and beach access. In reality, the view was heavily blocked by tall greenery, and we could barely see the ocean from the villa or the plunge pool (Villa 606). This was not at all what the photos on the website suggested.

Lack of Privacy: There was a shared door to the neighboring villa with a visible gap. Despite being told by staff that it had been “fixed,” no one inspected it — and only after I raised the issue again was it sealed with a strip of black tape… on the second-last day of our stay.

Delayed and Dismissive Service: For the first few days, our concerns were brushed off. I had to email the resort formally before the General Manager personally intervened, listened to our concerns, and offered a compensation. We appreciated that — but by then, the experience had already been tarnished.

Villa Host Experience: Our assigned host gave a basic tour, then forwarded PDFs of everything (dining, spa, excursions) via WhatsApp and left us to figure it out. No one tailored anything to our needs or offered suggestions — even though we were traveling with a baby. As a result, we didn’t engage in any resort experiences, and it felt like a missed opportunity — both for us and for the hotel.

Room Readiness: Basic amenities like the USB charging ports weren’t working when we arrived, and had to be fixed later.

Booking Confusion: Before arrival, we received repeated emails asking for pre-payment even though our booking clearly stated no advance payment was needed. I had to share screenshots to resolve this.

This does not mean that there weren't some good things offered at the resort. What was good:

The General Manager: Once involved, he took the matter seriously, met with us directly, and offered a resolution. His professionalism was appreciated — even though the damage to the experience had already been done.

Meuru (Staff Member): In the last two days, Meuru stepped in where others didn’t. He was responsive, helpful, stayed in touch via WhatsApp, and ensured our departure was smooth. He’s a true asset to the property.

Breakfast Team: Very friendly and attentive. They were especially sweet with our baby and even made us an iced Spanish latte on request — something not on the menu.

Departure Experience: We were given a late checkout until 5 PM, and everything was handled seamlessly from the villa.

Overall, this trip had the potential to be very special — but the mismatch between expectations and reality, the delayed attention to problems, and the lack of proactive service made it a regretful experience. I hope the resort takes this feedback seriously and improves, because at these rates, guests deserve much better.
title: A Disappointing Stay Saved Only by the General Manager and One Standout Team Member

text:
We were really looking forward to staying here and were extremely gutted that we were completely disappointed.
The rooms are very outdated and housecleaning does not pay attention to the fine details. We have had to tell the housecleaning department 3 times to spray balcony for all the ants every day so that we can enjoy the balcony day bed. Also the coffee and tea area had small tiny red ants as well so don't leave anything out. Conditioner runs out. Rooms aren't swept all the time so there's always sand around.
Breakfast is a big disappointment. I love they have a juice bar but the juice isn't strained so you are drinking pulp or pieces of shredded carrot. I think investing in a juicer like Breville would be great. The pancake and waffle batter are the same.
Lunch by the pool is extremely expensive and very poor quality. The only thing I liked was the garlic king prawns but after having it three times, I was done. Samosa's were extremely thick and very greasy. Calamari was very rubbery. Pasta was good. Drinks are really warm. We asked for Bloody Marry's with Ice and luckily I was able to ask the bartender to repeat my order and he understood, lot's of spice... ask for beer in an ice bucket. The food and drinks are very overpriced!!! The ice lollie's at 11:45AM was a big hit.
The Italian restaurant was horrible. We couldn't see our food even when they gave use a plastic cube with light. We were supposed to have a romantic dinner the following day but for $600 for no view of the ocean from the cliff and over cooked seafood and warm wine we immediately cancelled. Everything we ordered even the homemade chocolate they gave us was so sad.
We ate dinner on the last day at the dinning room. Kids were touching the squid tentacles. We hardly ate $50 worth of dinner that night.
We loved the surf opportunities the kids had with the contractor they had. The beach they take you to is amazing. We had more fun there then swimming in the hot pool. It was only 15 min away by tuck-tuk. Several kids would move the pool chairs that were in the water around so they could jump on them. About 8-10 year olds sat in the pool and used the small ledge to eat their bowls of ice cream all at the same time. I wish the rules were more enforced. I also had to tell the attendants to please clean up all the tissue paper around the floors. There are only set of bathrooms in the entire pool and dinning area. Sometimes it wouldn't be cleaned up.
The Asian restaurant is outside and very hot. We felt that the sushi we ordered could have been much colder. The drinks could have been much colder. there isn't much of a ventilation other than the fans above so you will smell like the grill near by.
My daughter and I did attend one session of yoga in the morning and that was lovely.
The spa was beautiful but having more options for the oils and a ginger tea after the session would have better. We couldn't drink the drink they gave us after our couples massage.
We loved our greeting and send off from the hotel. Everyone wants to help and tries to understand what you need with beautiful smiles. We did love the grounds of the hotel and the monkeys that would run around.
All that being said, I was hoping to feel rested after this trip but felt more annoyed that we spent so much money on 2 rooms at a hotel that did not resemble luxury or five stars. We will not be returning in the near future.
title: ....only to leave disappointed

South coast in general is getting built up fast but there are still some quiet areas.
Re demographics, the Anantara and the resort hotels of the South coast is majority Russian tourists these days. Not many other Europeans, North Americans etc. Other areas of Sri Lanka (cultural triangle, Galle, Yala, Ella, tea plantations) have more of a mix of tourists from all over the world.

text:
After a blissful trip in Sri Lanka (visiting Heritance Kandalama, Ceylon Tea Trails and Uga Chena Huts) our holiday has taken an unfortunate turn for the worse at Anantara Peace Haven. 

When we arrived I went into the women’s loos but the sensor for the lights didn’t work and the door closed behind me leaving the room in darkness. When I turned to leave I walked into a low ottoman in the centre of the room and cut my shins open on the sharp wood edge. Nobody at first acknowledged that what had happened was the hotel’s fault and instead stuck to their welcome script so I had the strange experience of sitting with bleeding legs being bandaged up while various people were talking us through the facilities and telling us what a wonderful time was in store for us. Only after speaking to our (very good) kuoni rep was I visited by a manager who did apologise and offered transport for one of our trips, which was much appreciated. 

Having bounced back from an embarrassingly tearful arrival we then went out super early the next day on a private speedboat whale watching trip. I paid around £500 for this for my partner’s birthday. I had prebooked this over email and wasn’t told at any point that we might not see any whales. I know on a safari you don’t choose what animals you see - but this trip was presented as a sure thing. And all the reviews on here seem to agree. But we saw no whales. I had hoped for a part refund of the fee given that the trip was misleadingly labelled, but only a refund of the transport costs has been offered. I guess I don’t legally have any rights here as I didn’t ask for a guarantee. I just trusted the marketing and now I feel very silly. So please be careful if you are planning to spend a lot to see whales! 

In summary, the resort itself is very nice, well landscaped, nice rooms, pretty beach and there are some lovely staff but I’ve spent most of my time here feeling unhappy/making complaints - with the result that it now feels uncomfortable being here. For the first time in my life I’m looking forward to leaving a holiday and going back to England.
title: Be wary of the whale watching trip

text:
To staff seemed overly tired and exhausted, which is most definitely a managing problem and reflects badly on the appearance of the hotel. Why fully occupy a hotel if you do not have the manpower to deliver what customers pay for?

I stayed here for 4 nights with my 4-year old daughter. We stayed at great properties in Sri Lanka in the days before and were looking forward to the relaxing days on the beach. But arriving at this hotel already irritated me. We were greeted by dramatic drums and blowing of a seashell, which I am sure might be appreciated by certain people but for me felt like going to the theatre. 

Room: 
I booked a Deluxe Ocean View Room, which was spacious but, unfortunately had no view of the ocean. My request for changing the room was denied since the hotel was allegedly almost completely full (I saw free rooms…). The room itself was not clean: my daughters socks were black after a few hours in the room and everything we touched was sticky or stained. The cleaning-crew worked very hard after my complaints, but I am sure their time was missing on other ends. Windows did not seem to be cleaned regularly. Nets against mosquitoes or repellent were not provided, the minibar did not get restocked once but is very loud. You can hear everything from the adjoining rooms, especially the heavy chairs being moved on the tiles of the floor.

Pool:
The water at the pool looked old and drinks and food which were ordered during the day were not cleaned. It looked really, really messy. They also tolerate the game of guests blocking sunloungers with towels. On the beach there are remains of what once must have been romantic beddings. They now can not be used anymore, look terrible and are a hazard for injuries. Theoretically there are life guards at the pool and the ocean (waves and tides are rather rough) but they also have to distribute and collect towels and drinking water at the same time, so there is zero time for them to actually „life-guard“. There are no places to change a swimsuit and restrooms are only found at the restaurant. Also no wifi on the beach.

Activities:
They are all absolutely and ridiculously overpriced and the communication around them took hours of my holiday. Again: this is not the fault of the people actually realizing the activities, but the chain of command in communication was not working. In this context I think it was rather annoying to receive daily messages by Anantara before arrival to ”enhance“ once stay. Also no communication before booking these activities about how these add-ons are modified due to Covid.
Also there are Tuktuks on the property which drive dangerously fast. It is an accident waiting to happen and not safe for children to run around freely.
My request for a late checkout took 4 days to be processed (only higher ranking staff apparently can take decisions, but I guess there are a lot of them piling up….), on day 4 I gave up since our driver needed the pickup-time to arrange the next transfer.

All in all I paid around 400 dollars/night in a supposedly 5 star hotel, which was definitely not worth the money. I felt tricked, treated like a cash cow and can not recommend staying here and will most definitely not return! I hope that the truly wonderful staff will start working at other hotels, where their commitment is truly appreciated and valued by their management.
title: Management failure…

text:
This will be one of my more interesting and complicated reviews to write. First, let’s start with the positive! The staff are very friendly and want the guests to be happy. Our favorite restaurant Verala was fantastic! The bar at Verla is excellent as well! Unfortunately, the Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle Resort must be short-staffed as the staff cannot provide the appropriate customer service required at a $1,000/night room rate. Read on to learn more……

For the negative, this resort is way too expensive for the room we were given. Our room was $1,000 per night, and I would say that it is worth $350 maximum. When we first arrived around 10:00 pm, we were given a bottom-floor room without a view. I asked to be moved, and about an hour later, we relocated to a top-floor room. The view from the room was lovely, but that was the only thing nice about this $1,000 a night room. Anantara had a 5-night minimum, so we were stuck with this rate for five nights. The room was very basic and similar to a standard Marriott or Hyatt at about $175 per night in the US. The furniture in the room was old, and the room itself was dirty with stains on the walls and floors. The bathroom was marginal at best. The only reason why I am complaining is due to the exorbitant price. I do not recommend anyone staying at Anatara in a premium room for $1,000/night.

We received a buffet breakfast for our $1,000/night with a 5-night minimum. The staff was lovely, but the food was marginal at best. In addition, the glass doors are filthy! There is food and oil all over the door handles and windows. 

The pool, beach area, and gym are perfectly fine but once again not worth $1,000 per night. 

We waited 2.5 hours to have our COVID tests on our last day. Once again, not up to the level of service for a room at $1,000/night with a 5-night minimum.

On our last night, we were told that we could not obtain a reservation at our favorite restaurant Verala as it was completely booked from outside the hotel reservations. Wait, what?!? I am paying $1,000 a night for five nights, and I can’t make a reservation at the hotel restaurant. Then I was told that I could come, but I had to preorder before the restaurant opened?!? Anyway, after throwing a fit, we were offered a table. That was fun, arguing on the last night of our vacation. 

The spa and the massages were definitely worth the price! The spa and the treatments were amazing! 

Sri Lanka is a beautiful country with friendly and kind people. However, it makes me sad that Anantara is overcharging its clients by such a ridiculous amount as I cannot recommend this property to anyone, and I will not return or experience any other Anantara resorts.

I am an avid traveler and relatively easy to please. I have no problem spending money while traveling, but I am not happy being ripped off and overcharged. Anantara, you should read some of my other reviews to learn customer service and proper pricing! You should be ashamed of yourself!
title: Excellent staff, extremely overpriced room, not at all worth the price, lovely spa but overall a rip off!!

text:
Decent beach hotel. Wouldn’t call it a five star or luxury boutique hotel. It’s more like a three star beach hotel. Here’s my detailed view of different aspects of the hotel from the experience.

Rooms
Booked a beach studio. The pictures indicated on the website are two ground level studios (beach studio category) and two upper level studios (Ocean studio category) with separate entrances.

We were initially given a room on the back that has like five or more rooms on the bottom and five on top. This is not even mentioned on the website. Furthermore our room was next to the bar and they were setting up for a themed dinner right in front of it. It was noisy as the management was giving staff on the spot instructions on how to set up. A meeting should have been held and this setup should have been done when guests were not in the rooms quaintly. I thought it was very unprofessional.

What ticked me off is that on this particular block with substandard rooms, only locals were put in. Didn’t see a single foreigner and they were all in the actual studios advertised with much better views and less disturbance. Coming from another beautiful boutique resort in Kalkudah where we got treated equally, I felt discriminated here.

If you book here make sure they don’t put you in the back. This should actually be turned into staff accommodation. It seems that way because it doesn’t go with the rest of the theme at all. Maybe they turned the staff rooms to guest rooms later to maximize profits.

We were later moved to an ocean suite which was nicer. Once there I realized the architect has copied the hotel next door (Mallu Mallu). They have given emphasis on the guests watching TV avoiding the possibility of a mesmerizing East Coast sunrise-view from bed! Recommend to redo the interior and if possible to rebuild the structures to the right when looking at the ocean to face the sunrise.

Other than that the amenities were decent. But not as a five star hotel which they claim to be. Only instant coffee. No Nespresso or simpler capsule coffee machine, no bathtub in studio, no Bluetooth entertainment system.

Food
The Sri Lankan dinner buffet and the set menu for lunch were good. But the breakfast spread was not good. The cheese (only two) was bland and dry possibly locally made. Not a single shooter as in five star hotel. No salmon or even tuna. Local coffee they served was watery and wasn’t brewed properly. At this dane age there’s access to many good local coffees such has Soul or Aga coffee plus it’s not an excuse for such a hotel to give excuses about import restrictions. Because these things are still widely available in Sri Lanka. This was commercial scale Harischandra or similar coffee which is just not real coffee and so outdated in 2022. It’s not hard for include a machine made cappuccino or latte with freshly grinned beans for breakfast without asking to pay extra. After all this is the most expensive hotel in Pasikuda. For me my whole day depends on the coffee I have and it ruined my day!

Staff
They are nice and pleasant but not exceptional. Some are very outspoken which doesn’t  go with a low key calm place like Pasikuda. Didn’t like them talking about work, guests, and planing so guests overhear. Major practical change management is needed here by an expert.

Also I noticed the staff were mainly Sinhalese speaking from far away areas. They have not hired locally hence the staff were not experienced to advise about anything outside the hotel. Hence it’s a major question on the CSR of Uga. I think hiring locally is key. Many talented Tamil and Muslims in the area. They will add a lot of character to the hotel.

Hotel
It’s too small and they have tried to maximize the little space they have by building structures too close to each other.  Feels campy and on your face. However it does have a lot of amenities such as a gym, pool and spa.

We only stayed here for one night and didn’t extend our stay. If you’re looking for a true five star resort I would recommend Anathaya Resort & Spa which was so much better.
title: Not a Five Star and Mismanaged

text:
Our stay at Uga Bay was far from how we wanted to experience our honeymoon. Despite the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor, and being rated number one in Kalkudah, our experience at Uga Bay was  far from that!

The rooms were fairly spacious and clean, which was the only positive aspect about the hotel.

We had such a horrendous experience of finding a cockroach in the complimentary fruit platter served to us and the issue was hushed  up by offering us four little chocolates on a massive platter by the management with no proper apology!

The overly helpful staff rather annoying, with about five different staff asking us how our experience was,knowing too well it was rather poor! 

The food at the hotel was the worst let down no doubt, with us being notified that there was no buffet as the hotel was in low occupancy at the time. We were given a menu with not much of a choice to choose from. The seafood options were very limited despite Uga being a beachfront hotel in the east coast of Sri Lanka.The food was tasteless to add more to the disappointment. Breakfast the  following morning was more or less the same experience and we were thankful that we went with the half-board option at the time of booking! 

The much looked forward to private dining experience on the beach also resulted in utter disappointment with the management deciding to take the beach dining experience indoors due to the heavy rain and insisting that the experience would be no different.The 25% cost reduction the management kindly offered us did not however compensate for the lack of ambiance or much rather for the unexciting food!

The main, which consisted of a seafood platter with 'big' prawns, and 'lobster' was a pathetic attempt of a meal. Again,the management underestimated our awareness of identifying or rather tasting 'shoe lobster' offered to us in the guise of real lobster.
  

Overall my husband and I were rather disappointed about our experience at Uga Bay as it certainly did not live up to the expectations, reviews or value for the price we paid!
title: A real let down of a 'boutique' hotel

Let me preface by saying that my husband and I will always make the best of any situation/find a way to have a great time and keep a big smile on our faces, but overall, this is the one hotel I wish we skipped during our trip to Sri Lanka.

1) Service - waiters were friendly and front desk staff polite.

2) Room - our room was very nice and was probably the best thing about this resort.

3) Location - I think during the prime season the Beach would be nice, but in December you can't really swim in the ocean.

4) Food - unfortunately the food here was a huge disappointment.  My husband is not a picky eater at all and even he couldn't stomach most of the food.  When I resorted to only ordering 'safe' food, I ended up having to spit out bones from a club sandwich. Gross. In the end, I skipped either lunch or dinner each day due to the poor food quality and that's saying a lot because I'm not one to ever miss a meal!

text:
This year we selected passikudha as our holiday destination & booked a 2 night stay at Uga bay. This hotel came highly recommended and we wanted to experience it for ourselves. After a long drive we arrived at the hotel to be greeted by the beautiful view of the beach and warm ambience of the hotel. The front office staff was friendly & attentive & without a delay we checked into our room. 

The room was spacious, tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom was large and fitted with all modern amenities. The room opened out to a beautiful pristine beach that seemed to stretch for miles. The wifi was very fast and cable TV had a large selection of channels which is not offered in many hotels. The housekeeping staff was very attentive and did a great job of keeping the rooms clean even after we had trailed in sand from our walks on the beach.   

We had booked on FB and so proceeded to have lunch which to our surprise was set menu,a detail which the hotel or the head office failed to mention when making the booking or when calling repeatedly to check our time of arrival. Sadly the food at this hotel was a very big letdown. The set menu had very limited options and so we optioned for a rice and curry and a seafood option. The rice and curry was cooked in the traditional Sri Lankan way and tasted nice while the seafood dish was very poorly done. It contained one grilled prawn and a small overcooked piece of fish with some badly done vegetables. Dinner turned out to be no better with limited variety of dishes on offer including a stir fried crab which was overcooked and tough. 

Also beware of what you order via room service as they can get the order wrong even after repeating the order multiple times. We ordered a sandwich and specifically asked them not to include pork which they did not adhere to.

Breakfast was passable but with almost the same dishes being served on both days. Another issue was the time taken to make to-order items such as eggs, as there was only one person manning three stations. 

So all in all what this hotel offers in beauty it lacks in its food. They need to offer a variety of food to their guests and make seafood items the hero of the dish. I was overall disappointed in the hotel and its standards as it certainly did not live upto the expectations, reviews or the price it commands.
title: Beautiful View but Disappointing Food
