text:
Venden ser un hotel de 5 estrellas pero no está a la altura (ni de lejos). Lo único que tiene de 5 estrellas son los precios. El precio de la comida es altísimo para la isla (y además de precios altos tienes que añadirle el 18% de VAT y además otro impuesto que de un 10% de "cargos y servicios".... una cena normal con agua no te baja de 60 euros (y de ahí para arriba).
Todo iba bien cuando llegamos, la atención del personal es impecable (muy amables y serviciales). Teníamos habitación chalet laguna y nos cambiaron a un chalet playa por el mismo precio. Aparentemente la habitación estaba bien salvo por los muebles algo antiguos, pero en cuanto se hizo de noche empezaron a aparecer todo tipo de bichos, desde cucarachas hasta gusanos y ciempiés que se colaban entre las maderas de las paredes y el techo (entiendo que estás en medio de la "jungla" y pueda haber bichos fuera) pero no es normal tener la habitación plagada de gusanos. Encima creo que tuvimos suerte porque hemos leído en comentarios que hay gente que ha encontrado hasta ratas...
Fuera tienes que ir por la noche con una linterna y por supuesto vas a encontrar todo tipo de insectos y reptiles...
Luego esta el inconveniente de los cuervos (pero ese problema no es del hotel sino de está en toda esta zona de costa este): los cuervos se tiran a por la comida y son muchos por lo que si estás tomando algo en la playa no te vayas a bañar hasta que no te lo hayas terminado...sino se lo tomarán ya los cuervos por ti.
La playa es bonita pero no esperes una playa de aguas cristalinas donde hacer snorkel.
Piscina con el agua turbia.
No le recomendaría este hotel a nadie aunque tiene potencial le faltan muchos detalles.

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
I have been a customer of Uga for some time now and with the brand loyalty and trust I had, I booked a very important new year holiday for my whole family - My wife, parents, and brother for the 12th & 13th of April 2024. We booked a jungle cabin and a lagoon cabin. I am a frequent traveller who has visit a lot of luxury resorts in SL speally the chain resorts such as cinnamon, jetwing, aithken spence, etc. However I have to say I was very disappointed with the overall product offered by Uga Jungle beach. 

First off, before I get to the negatives, I have to highlight the absolute positive and exceptional service provided by each and every member of the staff. The staff is extremely well trained and very very friendly and professional. From the host who welcomed us with a araliya flower to the porters, servers, house keeping staff, etc all the staff is very well trained and tried their best to give us a great service. Special call out to Mithila in the restaurant who served us very professionally and her amazing hard work deserves a lot of praise.

HOWEVER, let me explain why this deserves a one star, even after such great staff and service :

1. Quality of the rooms - Being a 5 star UGA resort, I would expect the rooms to be modern, clean and well maintained. However the truth is far from this - The rooms are run down and torn out. The walls are stained and the paint is peeling off. The cupboard and furniture were old, rusted and was not clean. The sofa had stains on it and the bed surely had bed bugs because the very first morning, I was itching beyond comfort. The TV is placed in such an odd way that watching it from the sofa or bed is near impossible. The washrooms are old, untidy and seriously not impressive at all. My absolute anger was the quality of the water bottles provided in the room. The water bottles were sealed in glass bottles (Kudos for not using plastic),  but the water tasted absolutely old, rusty and honestly very plastic-like. DISGUSTING.

2. Quality of the food - Being a foodie myself, this was where UGA really disappointed me. Let me start with dinner. The set menu was very poorly constructed and lacked any sort of cohesiveness. The bread rolls were hard as rocks, the butter served was broken and the clear crab soup I had was absolutely bland, no salt whatsoever and  honestly tasted like water that remains when you wash off a crab. The disappointment of the evening was the so called "Beef wellington". I have attached a photo below and you can see how overcooked the beef is. It was so disgustingly hard than it was almost un-edible. It lacked the signature mustard and prosciutto and the pastry was absolutely soggy. This dish is the worst I have ever had at a restaurant in my life! The mud pie for dessert was nice I have to say. Onto breakfast - For the first time in my life I was served an eggs benedict with a poached egg which was overcooked! Attached photo below. Was absolutely sad to be honest. I am sorry to sound entitled but I have dined at Rare by Uga in colombo, and i KNOW this is NOT the standards for food that UGA has. This is absolutely horrible and ruined my vacation to be honest.

3. Facilities - Poor facilities. The pool was not clean, the games room was (sorry), but a joke.

Overall I am sorry to see UGA which is a chain which I respected, letting me and my family down. I do not want to sound like a snob, however if I pay a premium for a high end resort, I expect the decency of the management to give every guest a value for what they pay. 

I am an advocate for business development so please feel free to reach out to me for any more details on this and I am happy to help. Again I have to say amidst all this, the staff was absolutely amazing. But due to this poor experience, I will not be visiting any UGA property and will definitely not recommend this to anyone.

Management of UGA - please get your house in order!!! Peoples vacation time should be respected!
title: Shockingly dissapointing! Horrible food and quality!

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
The service has completely ruined our vacation.

We were planning this stay for months and months with our friends and family and altogether we made a reservation for 04 rooms as this was a crowd of 12.

We checked into the hotel around 1.30pm and observed how unpleasantly the security guard was welcoming us. But we honestly disregard thinking that maybe he doesn’t speak Sinhala well. Then we were happily welcomed by the receptionist and after having the welcome drink the restaurant manager came in and gave all of us the menu for lunch stating that it will take bit of a time to arrange the meals. Mind it, it was a la carte menu. Then the manager came to me and my wife to note down the order. Then we mentioned, out of the two options under starters that we prefer ‘Spring rolls’. Then the manager’s response was “Okay then I will arrange 10 Spring rolls”. Then my wife said, “you better ask for others preferences as there are 04 families and this will be our preference”. Then again the manager’s tone got bit wild and he said “it is difficult for us to manage a group like that as we cannot find the guests. It’s better you stay at one table rather sitting here and there”. Myself and my wife looked at each other surprisingly to this so called restaurant manager and then I said “why don’t you take the order as per the room number as that’s how it happens everywhere”. Luckily the receptionist was listening to our argument type conversation and confirmed what I suggest and then he silently note down the order.

After checking into rooms, we came back to the restaurant to have our lunch. To my surprise, we had to wait for good 30 minutes to get the starter to our table. There were two waiters and this so-called restaurant manager came near the table but until such time they could only fill up the glasses. After several inquiries and waiting another 20-25 minutes we got the main course. And here comes the desserts. My wife ordered ice cream where as I ordered a fruit platter but we both received ice cream. Then I politely said, I ordered a fruit platter but you have given me ice cream. This so-called proficient restaurant manager who took our order raised his voice saying that “No! you ordered ice cream, you didn’t mention about a fruit platter”.  He showed his professionalism very well. His irritated behaviour, impoliteness completely ruined the positive image we had of this hotel.

It was the same when we came to have our dinner. We kept waiting for 25 minutes to have the dinner and after that we had to call several waiters asking to serve us dessert. And not to our surprise it was the very same on the next day breakfast time. We almost waited for 40 minutes. Food was dry (Sri Lankan menu – String hoppers, bread slices, small meal portions, unhygienic (crows flying with your food which is on the table and cats under the table) made us intolerant. So then I started to raise my voice to the restaurant manager and I showed him everything which was on the table and all he could say was “Sorry Sir”. I could only think of his lack of leadership to manage his crew and carelessness towards the local guests.

That one thing I clearly noticed is that the way the hotel treats the locals. It is disgusting and sad to see how they neglect the locals over foreigners. If the delays are due to a common problem it should be for everyone. But sadly it was not like that. During these difficult times, we visit these hotels thinking about everyone’s survival and enjoyment. Our vacation was disastrous at Uga Jungle beach and I don’t want anyone else to feel the same way.
title: “Worst Experience ever” - Aug 2022

text:
Just some of the shortfalls in this accommodation:
Front door of the room 40 could not be opened
Bashing and banging above us at room 40 so we were changed after unpacking to another room 37. 
Fridge not working at all in new room. Changed fridge and because of Heat Exchange type fridge it takes overnight to cool. We were given an Eski with ice in it to cool our soft drinks and the three Lion Beers I have per day. Fixed after two days. 
We find ourselves stuck in the middle of nowhere with nothing to do. No activities. 
The supposed Lagoon View is of a busy noisy highway. 
The Air Conditioner sounds like a Thunderstorm followed by Heavy Rain every time it cuts in. 
When we shower we have to stand in our own wast water due to no drainage. Even the next morning our waste water still stays in the Shower. 
The Front Awning is Ripped and Streached and with the continuous wind is Flapping making a thunderous bang all day and night. 
The Bed makes a massive Creak each time one of us gets out, thus waking the other. Worked on but not fixed. Still noisy. 
Half Board Dinner offers Soup, Starter, Main and Desert. We were told in no uncertain terms that we are only entitled to Three of the Four. Fixed after two nights. 
The Internet isn’t working correctly. As I have spare time along the way I Play an Internet Bridge Game and World Series Poker Game these have worked at all other sights.   As I appear to have lots of spare time with nothing to do here this is annoying. Fixed after three nights. 
We were told that at this time of year Trincomalee and Passikudah have the best weather for beach activities. It is and has been blowing 25 to 30 Kim wind for our whole stay and we are told this is normal. We would not have come to a Beach stay if we knew that. 

Manager Front Office has been helping with the above faults. There are only some that she can help with the rest we have to put up with. We should not have to Put Up With any shortfalls in 4 and 5 Star Accommodation that we paid for. 

Have a read through all of the 12 above and then tell me if you would be happy with these shortfalls. 

Don’t be fooled by the looks here and on Internet.

text:
Here are some things you should
know before booking this hotel. In all the facilities are OK but not 5 star by any means. The main redeeming feature was the appetite to make money dishonestly. Here are some things you should know before booking this hotel:

1) it’s extortionate- the prices here (once you read the fine print and include the taxes) are akin to London prices. Don’t expect to pay less than £8-10
2) check your bill! We had a situation whereby items we ordered didn’t show up and were charged anyway.
3) double check your bill! We also had instances where drinks ordered were allocated to our room twice (once from initial order, second time from us chasing the staff).
4) the “Happy hour” doesn’t exist. We were charged on two occasions for the usual price for so called happy hour (half price drinks).
5) the amenities shut very early, don’t expect food or service after around 10-10:30pm.
6) the pond is dirty and the fish gasp for air. There is insufficient oxygen flow, and it’s hard to watch.

We do not scrimp on holiday, but do not appreciate being incorrectly charged. When we left, and highlighted incorrect charges ( which also included a round of drinks from another table!) we received no apology, only an acknowledgement of our delay in leaving! Avoid this hotel!
title: Not great, not 5 star, poor customer service!

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were really looking forward to this place, as a relaxing escape to cap off a month's-worth of travel in South and Southeast Asia. While the secluded beach is lovely, and most of the staff is nice, we felt trapped and ripped off at every turn, and left leaving with a bad taste in our mouth . The resort is best-suited for travelers who don't want activities besides the beach, don't mind being overcharged for absolutely everything, and prefer resorts to interacting with the real Sri Lanka. You can find more competitive rates at hotels closer to town. FWIW, we loved the Cinnamon properties we stayed at. 

Below is a summary of our main concerns:
1) Price gouging:
Within a few hours of checking in, the hotel started trying to gouge us by trying to make us pay a second person occupancy additional fee that was never mentioned to us during booking or check-in, and being incredibly rude and aggressive in pursuing this until we threatened to leave. This is ridiculous because: a) we checked in with two passports and no one mentioned this upon check-in, b) all amenities in the room we were given was for two people and the hotel's own daily newsletters asks that you not walk alone on the property demonstrating that they mean to accommodate couples or groups. WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT BOOK DIRECTLY THROUGH THE JUNGLE BEACH WEBSITE. Later, after some research, we realized that the Jungle Beach website tacks on tons of extra fees (occupancy, 30% tax) but only does so at the last page after you've already approved of your rate. This is handled differently by other price comparison websites like hotels.com / Expedia / booking.com etc. which defaults to 2-person occupancy without tacking on hidden costs or surcharges at the very end. They also tend to offer cheaper rates. 

2) Remote location with little to no option to leave the premises:
The hotel is a 30-min drive or 40-min tuk tuk ride to the center of Trincomalee. This needs to be more clearly advertised when you are booking. This means that all your food, drink, activities and any other needs need to be taken care of by the hotel. Forget about buying sunscreen or extra medicines or toiletries - there's no gift shop or arrangements so you have to arrange a visit into the city. While the hotel is able to organize a tuk-tuk for you, they neither advertise or encourage it, and they won't let outside tuk-tuks or cabs even onto their premises to pick you up if it is pre-arranged. Given the remote location, it is standard for a resort like this to offer either complimentary or a discounted shuttle service into the city. 

3) Overpriced airport transfer to Trinco: The hotel charges ~$70 for a 1-hour taxi transfer to the Trincomalee Airport where Air Taxis (Cinnamon and other operators) take off. This absolutely is not competitive pricing and is exploitative of guests. As this is a developing country, $70 is more than you would pay to rent a cab for regional travel for an entire day in Sri Lanka. The going rate is 80 LKR per KM of travel so the cab fare (even if you double it to account for the lack of a return fare) should be no more than $35, making it half of what the hotel charges.

4) Limited range of activities, none free
The hotel releases a newsletter of activities available for the next day, but virtually all of the activities stay the same from day to day and are limited to pricey outdoor/ nature activities to spa activities. There are no gym classes, cultural activities, and nothing is free. The few beach toys they advertise as "free" is limited to one beach volleyball, and no one seems to be able to locate it. So remember if you stay here, you're basically stuck at the resort WITH NOTHING TO DO - no library, no gift shop, no board games, nothing that you would expect for a resort at this price.
title: Average, secluded hotel that tries to rip you off at every turn

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
This hotel is a 2-3* hotel. Their advertising is at best misleading, but i would say it is false advertising. The hotel is known in Pasikuda as paying for false reviews from locals. It is so far behind the other hotels on this beach you really shouldnt stay here. Do not believe the glossy photos!!!

The hotel charges substantially less for locals and when we were there it had bus loads of locals decending on the hotel enmasse for buffet and around the place.

Restaurants:
- DO NOT ORDER THE BUFFET. There is one very poor, limited selection buffet and one beach restaurant. The other restaurants dont exist or are "closed and dusty". The beach restaurant does decent food and our lobster and fresh fish plus french wines came in at HALF the price of the buffet (buffet was USD54.50 per person per night including children)
- they advertise 4 or 5 restaurants. this isnt the case. It is false advertising. there are two.
- the main restaurant is a sauna even at 8pm at night.

Gym
- is a dangerous disaster with everything falling apart (see pic).

Pools
- both main pool and our plunge pool had bugs in it. bugs that live in the pool, not floating on top.

Rooms
- we paid UDS900 per night for 2 ocean view suites. They are advertised with a plunge pool. This is shared between FOUR apartments (see pic of 4 apartments who use one pool). When we turned up there were 8 people in our allocated plunge pool. It isnt exclusive even to the four apartments so you pay for something you dont get. 
- appointment is at best shabby chic. or you could say 2-3* hotel. They are best described as Premier Inn (UK) or Travelodge / Motel 6.
- there is junk piled up in corridors between rooms

Management
- our daughter noticed and we then couldnt unsee it that the managers are nice to guests, but then immediately lose their smile and are angry at all the staff. We had a situation where we wanted a plate cleared from our table and asked the manager. He then asked someone else so we had two men standing pointing at a plate whilst the poor waiter rushed over to clear. We didnt see this anywhere in Sri Lanka and this is our 10th visit.

We left two days into our four day stay as it is so bad. For somewhere great stay at the 5* Uga Bay next door which is magnificent in every way. 

It definitely isn't a place we could recommend.
title: THIS IS A 2-3* HOTEL NOT A 4 of 5* HOTEL

text:
Tired and dirty.

Our room was a little windowless dungeon that was very dark. It was frustrating to have to walk through sand to enter your room and use a water pot (usually coated with bird crap) to wash your feet.

The bathroom was concrete flooring and looked like a public toilet in certain aspects. 

We had two small vertical windows in our room and only one lamp. It was dark and gloomy.

The mattresses were also all buckled making for a very uncomfortable sleep. You sleep in a cocoon basically.

As usual, vegetarian options are very limited. You can not in good conscience offer 2x chicken curries, fish curry, lamb curry and then force the vegetarians to eat only dhal and a few small side dishes (without gravy)where are the vegetarian skewers? Where is the veg meat/soya meat.

These are lazy poorly trained chefs that would not make it in any other first world country due to a lack of skill, effort or dedication to their craft. It shows. 

Dining experience is on par with the rooms. Avoid this place.
title: Poor.

text:
So I made my booking for the 14th - 15th of September 2019 (1 night) for a Quadruple room. 

Point 1: I received a call on the 13th asking about my arrival (the time etc), I mentioned that I will be arriving at 12:30 PM, and I was informed that the check-in was at 2:30 PM which I was ok with. So after a very long drive from Colombo on the 14th, our family arrived at 12:30 pm and we were welcomed etc and we started with Lunch cause the room was only gonna get ready by 2:30 PM. At 2:30 PM I went to reception and asked about my room. It was only then that the manager rushed to the room and got the guys to clean the room for us and told us that it will take 15 mints to get the room ready. at 2:45 I went again to reception and inquired about the room, the manager there mentioned that the room is still not ready and that it'll take another 45 mints. This was a great concern as my parents and all of us were so tired after a long drive and we were made to sit outside till the room was ready. I believe that the "first impression is the best impression" and the first impression for us was so bad.

Point 2: The AC on the upper deck of the room was not cooling at all. I called the reception to get a person to check this and I got a maintenance guy, the guy mentioned on some setting and I changed it accordingly but the setting kept going back to default after sometime which made the room so heated up and not comfortable at all. We go to a hotel to relax and enjoy. But how could a person relax and enjoy when the room is freaking heated up? I had to wake up almost 5 times in the night to change the settings of the AC

Point 3: The food, again I won't be too picky cause in my opinion it wasn't the best. Only the breakfast (on 15th) was up to our expectation. 

In case anyone from the hotel is reading my comments, please refer to the feedback I provided. The guy at the reception read it and still didn't want to apologies or comment anything about it. 

In my opinion, the hotel was not up to my expectations. I don't think I would want to visit this hotel again for sometime and will not recommend this hotel to my friends/office (for annual trips)

Sorry about my comments above, but had to tell my honest opinion.

Regards,
title: Poor service nothing wow about it

text:
We booked months ago, for one week.  We booked the panoramic suite at $180 US.   On first entering the hotel, the views were very attractive.   However, that’s where the panorama ends.  None of the rooms in this hotel have views of anything once you are in the room.   You would not know you were at the beach.  The rooms are dark.  This is because of the fault in the architectural design of this hotel.  It is built on the smallest block of land compared to the expansive grounds of all the neighbouring hotels.  We paid the extra $50 per night for the ocean views, but felt really cheated, as it did not deliver.
Twice we had to call reception as the electricity in our room cut out, and once the hot water cut out.
In the middle of one night, part of the ceiling above the shower fell and woke us up. 
The staff are very friendly but not very efficient in the dining area.  When food or drink ran out at breakfast they had to be asked to refill things. 
In our experience it is a family hotel, lots of children, not a couples hotel.  The rooms were kept clean.
We would not recommend this hotel because it is false advertising to say “ panoramic views”.  There are no views at all from inside the rooms, and when we compared the prices with a number of other hotels there, it is expensive.
At $180  per night it is expensive in comparison to many beach hotels in the world of this standard.
title: Very bad value for money

Your booking was made on “room only” basis at the rate of 300 USD therefore meals were not included. August being the peak month for the east coast, the price was due to the high demand for the hotel and it should be mentioned that the hotel was occupied 100% during your stay.

Upon your complaint that the hot water was not available in the room, the manager asked whether you called the reception to inform that there was a problem with hot water, which you misunderstood as being rude. 
We never serve our clients “juice from the supermarket carton”, all beverages served are freshly made. And there weren’t any local guests in the pool who were fully clothed. We did offer you a dinner as a gesture of goodwill, and you mentioned that you were happy.

text:
The PROS:

- Beautiful location and setting on the sea

- Very unique design in the tents and comfortable beds (no black-out in the tents though)

- Fun and short safaris - do ask for Keith as your ranger! Jeeps are comfortable and safaris are well organised, they will do everything for you to have a good experience and understanding as much as you can about animals.

The CONS:

- Staff at the restaurant was unexperienced and our orders came everytime wrong and late. We had dietary requirements and they kept forgetting over and over. This is far from a luxury type of experience.

- Our stay was RUINED by kids shouting and jumping in the main pool all day, including during dinner or breakfast. There should be rules about the pool. We also had a pool cocoon and all we heard all day were children crying. 

- Housekeeping coming everytime when we are in the room, disturbing when. They KNOW for a fact we go on Safaris, when we eat and what we do all day - why not taking advantage of that to make yourself more discrete?

You pay about USD 1000 full board, you should get impeccable experience for that price. Not a luxury experience and not up to the standards of Ceylon Tea Trails.

placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
The cocoons are amazing and so are the conservation efforts.  However the service experience needs a lot of work starting with reservations (Nigel). When we enquired on how to get to the resort he suggested a private seaplane charter costing close to 3000USD when scheduled commercial flights was available. Incorrect invoices and rescinding an offer of two games drives to 1 game drive followed. No one contacted us pre arrival to help us plan our stay by suggesting activities etc (the website was thin on any kind of information other than corporate messaging). It turns out only game drives and a pathetic spa was on offer. 
Our prearranged (and pre paid) transfer from Weerawila military airport arrived 40 minutes after the plane arrived. Given that this was a military airport and we were not even allowed out of the hut that served as the terminal building this was a scary 40 minutes for us. The delay was due to the hotel giving the wrong last digit of the car number (since driver and car has to pre-registered for clearance prior to entry). 

The spa service was a nightmare - lights were too bright, bed too uncomfortable, no welcome or post treatment drink  (until I started coughing and then a bottle of water was handed to me), no towel or shower cap for a shower and a worse than average massage delivered by a Balinese (why not use locals?)
The food was good , especially the hoppers at breakfast (the honey one is fabulous!) . F&B Service staff were good considering the hotel has only been opened for 5.5 months (ie you should lower your expectations). We really enjoyed our game drive and our ranger was a biologist who answered all our questions with knowledge and enthusiasm for his craft. 
I was woken up the first morning at 8:30 by a bunch of guys planting trees outside my cocoon. What a racket! You can image there is absolutely no way I could have pulled down the blinds given that they were working out there all day (the bathroom is pretty dark) Given that only 19 cocoons were occupied out 28 I don’t understand why they could not have rescheduled the work at another time. 
Given that the resort is owned by the Dilmah people , only 4 types of tea were available at the restaurant. Unbelievable! 

The hardware cannot make up for the service which lacks initiative, empathy and heart. The management doesn’t  seem to   realise  that guests that pay >700 USD a night deserve better service and more activities. Senior management needs to visit more than once a month. Next time I will stay at Uga Chena Huts just next door.
title: Overpriced & underwhelming service

text: This was the most expensive hotel we stayed  at in Sri Lanka.  The food was very bad.  Our room was next kitchen and noisy. Although the staff was very nice,  they were overbearing, probably because there were very few people staying there.  We do not recommend staying here.
title: Would not recommend this place.

ownerResponse/text:
Inconvenient truths...

I won’t thank you for your lack of festive goodwill and empathy for my team - at full stretch on their busiest day of the year. However, I will highlight some inconvenient truths for the sake of balance, on behalf of 100+ local performers who entertained us magnificently on New Year’s Eve (save for you) and my all-Sri Lankan hotel team. 

You chose a hotel that celebrates New Year’s Eve enthusiastically and charges accordingly. The truth is, you were aware of this and in particular, that supplements would be charged for the night, before choosing to stay here. As published on our website and advised by your travel agent, “US$125 per-person New Year’s Eve/peak season supplement (kids 5-12 @ 50%) includes everything we serve from 8pm onwards (31st)” and “…. New Years’ Eve (31st Dec) per-person supplements are charged irrespective of your participation or level of consumption and are charged to your bill automatically”. 

The truth is, upon arrival (before sitting down even!) you chose to ignore the above and to me directly, dismissed out of hand the joy of celebrating with others (to save money?).  You asked us not to charge the supplements because, you had no wish to join in. My manager explained clearly why we charge supplements and that your travel agent had already charged you in fact, he reminded you again that you were informed fairly and squarely, in advance. Justly so, my manager resisted further pressure to cancel the supplements and a table for 3 was duly reserved on your behalf. Unfortunately, you missed the free cocktails, canapés and moreover, the conviviality at the start of the evening, although you somehow arrived early for a dinner not due to be served until much later – hence perhaps, your perception of a late meal (the only one we can think of).
 
You went to bed early on New Year’s Eve due to an early morning safari booked with your driver - you asked for takeaway breakfasts before leaving the restaurant. Yes, I'm sorry to say we got your breakfasts completely wrong at 5am on New Year’s Day, for which we have apologized many times. It had somehow been wrongly assumed by one of us that you would return late morning for a full cooked breakfast, as almost all guests do after their morning excursions - alas, we provided only snacks to nibble. For the record, you were given 3 apples, 3 oranges, 3 bananas, 6 homemade preserve pastries – free snacks for 3 people – and offered a full menu breakfast upon your return to the hotel.
 
We met later that day, the latter part of lunchtime. I politely inquired whether you’d enjoyed yourselves in the morning to which you replied most vociferously, complaining about your breakfasts. Taking your complaint seriously I apologized unreservedly, as did my manager, our guest host, and a steward you'd also complained to. As a gesture of goodwill, I also waved off your entire lunch bill that day "whatever you want from the menu" to your apparent satisfaction – another truth you fail to mention. We tried hard and generously to make amends.

To conclude, the inconvenient truth behind your irresponsible review, stems from wrong choice of hotel and your failure to renege on agreed terms once ensconced in the hotel. This might surprise you but, all other New Year’s Eve guests thanked the team and me personally for an enjoyable night, most of which you actually missed, including a spectacular finale and firework show your son at least may have enjoyed? By coincidence, guests who spent that evening with us are still here, and as mystified as I am by the petty falsehoods behind your words. Others at the time, after the air cleared, asked, who were those people? 
    
Nick Buckingham
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Unfortunately our return trip to Buckingham Place was one we should of missed, pack out breakfasts which consisted of an apple and an orange, meal orders which constantly were wrong or late and new years evening was definitely one to miss. The accommodation was however clean.
title: Service and food has been surpassed by other establishments.

ownerResponse/text:
I await the outcome of an investigation into whether your submission falls within Trip Advisor guidelines. Because you have no substantive experience of this hotel or restaurant other than to a) arrive without a reservation and b) not accept/believe the property was fully occupied and thus unable to receive you, you have neither experience nor knowledge of it but write misleadingly as if you do. I reply in the interim, after interviewing members of my team and reviewing CCTV/audio footage.

1.	Whilst our Sri Lankan security guard speaks Sinhala and only a little English, I’m satisfied he politely and effectively communicated to you that our hotel and restaurant were exclusively occupied and that also, he’d call a senior colleague to elaborate further – which he duly did and for which you waited less than 3 minutes.
2.	Your fictitious comments about staff, patrons and noise emitting from the property are offensive and pure troublemaking, but regardless of my observation or opinion they are wholly untrue and could be nothing else. Given you did not enter nor could you see inside the property how could you possibly judge what was or wasn’t going on inside? For example, our restaurant is a long way from our closed/screened gates (app.100m) and at a different elevation to the entrance beyond which you did not progress – it can’t be seen even when our gates are fully open.
3.	I and most others who have seen the property know it is ‘...beautiful and the view spectacular’ as you say. You don't know this from first-hand experience however, neither do you have any idea of our service capability - we didn't serve you. What size this 'crowd' or nature of imagined 'nightmare' I wonder?
4.	You arrived at our property without a reservation only to become angry and aggressive at failing to gain access from an ordinary man (used to big cars) who was simply doing his job. In less than 3 minutes a senior member of the team arrived to assist, but, no sooner had he shaken your hand he too became a target for your rage and menacing threats, before he could even start to elaborate on what had been said by his colleague!
5.	You shouldn't be surprised that NONE of us think it fair that two valued members of the team felt intimidated and remain shaken today. Being bullied simply for doing ones job is sad, incomprehensible and plain inexcusable.
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Coming every year in Galle and Tangalle we tried for the first time this hotel

The garde in the gate was as rude and  impolite  maybe coming in a diplomatic black limo he wanted to give us a lesson!

The hotel was occupied by a big  group and it was a nightmare

Of course place is beautiful and view spectacular but what a poor service

Avoid this hotel

Amanwella , Anantara very close are so much better for and equivalent price Much more charming and you will feel welcomed 

You will see also  what is a good service ..
title: Terrible

placeInfo/address: No. 6 Wadumunnegedara, Marawila 60200 Sri Lanka
text: Based on the previously posted reviews of Horathapola, we were greatly looking forward to staying there on our recent trip tio Sri Lanka.  Horathapola was adequate at best, but certainly not up to the caliber of the other hotels that we stayed at in Sri Lanka.  I found Pia (the owner) to be quite cold and the service indifferent.  The food was uninspiring (we had far better meals elsewhere) and the room was uncomfortably warm.  We were led to believe that we would be provided with an escorted tour of the estate with the manager.  Instead we were led around by a worker who did not speak English.  The staff, in general, was poorly trained.  I was shocked that they did not provide mosquito nets.  As a result, my son and I received over a dozen bites each on our first evening in Sri Lanka.  We would not stay at Horathapola again, nor would we recommend it to anyone else.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: No. 51 Beach Road Tangalle, Unakuruwa 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Отдыхали в отеле с подругой с 23.10-02.11.23. Никогда в жизни не писала отзывов, но здесь не могу пройти мимо. Почти все, что пишут про отель не правда. Отель находится на горе, дойти оттуда по этой невыносимой жаре до пляжа невозможно. Брали тук-тук. До Сайлент бича пешком минут 20 по грязи и нищите. На Сайлент бич в океан войти нельзя, волны огромные. Пляж, который в 5 минутах от отеля не оборудован от слова совсем, там нет ни кафе, не лежаков, ничего, если вы привыкли отдыхать дикарями и за огромные деньги лежать на песке, то тогда да, но этот пляж очень грязный, там плавают пакеты и прочий мусор. В отеле идет стройка! Отель не достроен, его хозяин просто снимает деньги с русских, потому что-то из-за хороших отзывов все едут сюда. Да в отеле они стараются, это правда, все делают по первому зову, но этот вечный стук с 6 утра до 10 вечера, это сильно. Полчище насекомых, с которыми они почти не борятся, это ужасно, это все ползает по кроватям, спасались нашим гардексом, но на утро было «кладбище» животных во всем номере. У нас был верхний номер для молодоженов, текла постоянно крыша и конденсат капал на балконе. Брали с видом на океан, вид, действительно шикарный, жаль, что это только вид. По рекомендации вышеписавших брали завтрак ужин, есть нечего! Питались хлебом и ананасами. Потом я очень долго разговаривала с хозяином, добилась того, что на завтрак стали делать подгоревшие блины. Рис не съедобен весь, сладости еще хуже, зато есть видов 10 круассанов на завтрак. Про колбасу, сыр можете забыть в этом отеле, даже разговоры не помогли. На ужин, готовят морепродукты, но есть можно только креветки, рыба отвратительная из-за того, что она не свежая, а замороженная. Они все стараются, но готовить не умеют, хотя странно, то, что ты заказываешь по меню(платно) очень даже съедобно. Откуда отзывы про отель, потому что действительно хозяин ходит и дарит различные «подарки» то пиво бесплатно, то кокос, то мороженное. Обычно дают всем что-нибудь на их усмотрение в обед. На ужин подходит лично к гостям и тоже общается. На ужин и на завтрак все напитки платно. На завтрак писали про свежевыжатый соки, отжимают их дня 3 назад, похоже, так что пить их нельзя. Через неделю нашего пребывания научились пользоваться кофе машиной, потому что то кофе, что они пытаются варить сами, невозможно. Ходить по отелю придется очень много, хоть он и не построен, бесконечное количество лестниц, а по этой невыносимой влажности то еще удовольствие. Если ты не говоришь по-английски, делать там нечего, по-русски никто не понимает. Для нас это не проблема, но вдруг кому-то важно. Рецепшена нет, то есть, если ты вечером хочешь где-то посидеть, то это невозможно, потому что ресторан, бар, рецепшен-это все одно место, рядом же есть бассейн. Отель называется Спа, но ничего из спа, кроме массажа там нет, делает неплохо, но к ланкийцу надо записываться, потому что он приглашенный и постоянно в отеле не находится.  До дороги минут 5 пешком, ни один автубус туда не заедет! Вас заберут от автобуса на тук-туках. Охраны в отеле нет, сколько бы мы ни ходили, не видели ничего похожего на охрану, я понимаю, что нормальные ланкийцы в такую гору не полезут, но все-таки хотелось бы какой-то защиты, как в НОРМАЬНЫХ отелях. В связи с вышеперечисленным и обо всей стране сложилось соответствующее впечатление. Кстати, берите тапочки, на всех пляжах огромные камни и за счёт волн, тебя на них отбрасывает, моя подруга порезалась об него, так что будте аккуратны. Надеюсь мой отзыв поможет, чтобы русских перестали обманывать об этом «шикарном» отеле

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan! (May you live long) 

Dear Ms. Nuwanthi,

Greetings from Aditya Resort!

Thank you for your comments.  We, at Aditya have always welcomed constructive criticism and have taken careful note of your post.

Firstly, we deeply regret the disappointment caused to you and your family by the non-fulfillment of your expectations and extend our sincere apologies in this regard.

The late arrival of towels was due to the current Covid-19 health & safety guidelines set out by the Governmental Authorities. Towels have to be issued strictly according to the guidelines given to us and this accounts for the delay.  

Further, meals served on “Full Board Bookings” are based on a set Menu and not on the full A la carte selection.  Looking into your complaint it was noted that both dinner and breakfast were consumed over 30 minutes from the time of serving,   this would have accounted for the state of the food, especially Kiribath and Pittu which is made of Millet (Kurakkan).

Once again please accept our apologies if we have not kept up to the high standard of service we have set ourselves.

Best regards,
Aditya Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Been visiting this hotel as a family and even as a solo traveler for many years. The place has always been beautiful and the rooms continue to be maintained. That however, is the only positive thing about Aditya anymore. 
The service is below par, with us having to make multiple requests to get anything as simple as towels brought to the room.
The highlight however, of the bad experience we had this weekend, was the food!! I don’t even know where to start... The set menu offered for dinner was limited to three selections. Chicken, fish or mixed seafood. The chicken was so inedible I had to spit it out and the seafood tasted mediocre. Quantity was inadequate and the only thing that tasted ok was the chocolate brownie. 
Breakfast was equally bad with the kiribath looking like dry pittu and tasting worse. 
No one from the restaurant bothered when it was brought to their attention that the food wasn’t good and over all the service was not what you would expect of a hotel that is supposed to be renowned for its service. 
Disappointing is putting mildly and it’s sad that a hotel with so much potential isn’t living up to it. We checked out a day early because continuing to stay was not even considerable.
title: So disappointed!

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Aditya Resort!

While we regret that this reviewer was disappointed with the experience at Aditya, we feel compelled to refute the many misrepresentations made in this account.

Firstly, we take pride in the accuracy and authenticity of all the content on our website, including the pictures. For simple proof, they can be compared to the many traveller photos posted on this tripadvisor page.

It must be noted that the reviewer did not book with us. Their original hotel had overbooked them. When their travel agent reached out to us, we agreed to host them in one of our Shanthi Suites at short notice and a concessionary rate.  

Contrary to assertions made here, our Shanthi Suites have ample natural light and are maintained to exemplary standards. We have never hitherto received complaints of unpleasant odours. We do not light fragrance sticks in the rooms, and we certainly did not on this occasion.

Nevertheless, the guest demanded a sea view room and after another intervention by the travel agent, we upgraded them to Surya, our most luxurious suite. This dual-level room offers sweeping views of the beach and ocean. We are baffled by this strange description of ‘a field of machines and generators’.

Incidentally, our hotel does have a generator. It is sound-proofed and located away from the guest buildings. It is activated only during power failures, and none occurred during the reviewer’s stay. So once again, we are puzzled by this claim of ‘insufferable noise’.

As for the deprecating remarks made about our staff, we can only draw attention to the effusive praise they receive from the vast majority of tripadvisor commentators. We urge readers to consider the totality of opinions and ratings available here and draw their own conclusions. 

Best regards,
Aditya Resort
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Our experience at the Aditya Boutique Hotel was absolutely disappointed. First their website is a big joke ! Nothing from the hotel looks like the pictures from the internet ! Prices are completely exaggerated. Our room was a Santhy Garden view suite - horrible. No natural day light, it smelled sticky and old. They put some fragrance stick to hide this terrible smelling. After complaining they gave us an upgrade to a another suite on the first floor. It was a huge room. From the balcony we had a vue on a field of machines and generators that made an insufferable noise from 6 o’clock in the morning to 11 in the evening. We could feel the vibrations even in our bed.
This hotel is old and the atmosphere is oppressive and even the staff looks depressed and sad. There is no fun, no laughing. For sure we will never come back to this hotel.
title: Absolutely Disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan! (May you live long) 

Greetings from Aditya Resort!

We are truly sorry that the reviewer did not stay with us but was there only for a couple of hours and decided to leave without experiencing Aditya. 
 
We always welcome constructive criticism but were rather surprised to read the comments made about the images on the website. The images do not do justice to the actual appearance of Aditya.  All our rooms, facilities and location are depicted as accurately as possible in the visuals posted on our website.
 
The comment made about the welcome drink not being served on arrival is untrue.The reviewer and partner were welcomed with frangipani garlands as we do for all our guests and offered face towels, fresh passion fruit juice was served but was declined.
 
The reviewer had reserved a Shanthi Suite which is located on the ground floor with garden view. This was booked through one of the leading Agents in the UK. As a part of the arrival experience the plunge pool is filled with fresh water on the day of arrival and it should not be interpreted as stagnant water. As an alternative, we offered another Suite but the reviewer did not show any interest in seeing the room. 

The vast majority of our guests praise our cuisine, but we regret to note that the reviewer did not like the food as much as the others.

As a leading resort in the industry we maintain our standards as per our guests requirements and Aditya leaves all our readers with these indisputable facts, and urges them to draw their own conclusions. 

Our sincere hope is that the reviewer will one day return to Aditya and experience the warmth and hospitality that we are reputed for.

Best regards
Aditya Team
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We looked at pictures on website to book this hotel, but had a complete shock when we arrived there. We were not offered a welcome drink, unlike all other places we had stayed in. We were taken to our somewhat luxury room, but a huge but, as the room was dark shabby, with small walled garden offering no light, the bathroom was a disaster with broken tiles in shower and a Jacuzzi filled with stagnant water.  We had lunch while deciding what to do and the food was sadly awful.  The staff in the dining room were delightful and felt sad for them, but there was no choice but to check out of this place as quickly as possible.  sorry hotel but have nothing positive to say except your dining room staff trying so hard to keep us there, but no chance
title: downmarket

placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were very disappointed with our stay. The beach is unswimmable due to a dangerous shorebreak and vicious currents,  one cannot walk next to the water because of the steepness of the aforementioned shorebreak, the beach itself is filthy.
The picture of the pool area on this site is totally misleading - while the pool is clean the surrounds are rather plain and uninviting.
The food is mediocre at best, the front desk not forthcoming with useful information. The tackiness of finding condoms in our bathroom with the usual cotton wool showercap etc was very offputting  Why do that ??? This is supposed to be an upmarket hotel!! The nearest town Hikkaduwa has no redeeming features.
On a positive note the staff are very nice particularly in the restaurant where we ate breakfast.
I would not recommend.
title: not a beach holiday, a sitting at an average pool holiday

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest ,
 
Ayubowan from Aditya
 
Thank you for your review.  At the outset please allow us to apologize for not meeting your expectations.

At Aditya we serve a wide assortment of foods from different cuisines, with an emphasis on fresh Seafood. However, it has always been our policy not to serve pork on the menu. We apologize if this was an encumbrance to you.

Our Bar captain Indika is an award winning barman and our cocktails have been  very well accepted and have also won many awards and accolades at various competitions.  However, once again, we apologize that our bar did not deliver as per your expectations.

Our front office is manned 24 hours and our staff handle all guest relations issues and has been specifically complimented by many of our guests.

 At Aditya we endeavour to provide a peaceful, private and tranquil experience. Therefore we do not have any major activities at our property unless it is a festival. However, the front office has been providing and assisting our guests with information regarding activities in the area. We also arrange a variety of tours and excursions, the details of which are placed in the suite. Additionally our front office and staff are always available to answer queries or questions.
 
The beach in front of the property is always cleaned and we are investigating why this was not done when you were here.

Once again we are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We sincerely hope that you will visit us again and give us another opportunity to serve you better.
placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
After touring Sri Lanka for 10 days, I was super excited to arrive in Aditya. From the photos on internet, the reviews and the price per night, it looked like an extraordinary hotel.
The reviews being so enthusiastic, I imagined heaven on earth.
To begin with the list of my complaints: no pork served (meaning beef bacon and chicken sausage at breakfast), a very average pool, terrible cocktails, no activities, no guest relations, no business hub...
The beach is nice but not cleaned daily. Although beach is public in Sri Lanka, a little cleaning in front of the hotel can't harm. 
The Shanti suite advertised as huge was big but nothing impressive either. Large king size bed but uncomfortable mattress. The small tropical garden adjacent to the room is pretty and well maintained but the high walls around it make it somewhat suffocating. The large outdoor bathroom is by far the best part of the room (jacuzzi pool).
The Wi-Fi is anything but reliable.
What I liked: the service (kindness), the food, the tranquility and the decoration.The a/c was working well.
Also Aditya has its own tuk tuk & taxi service. Although the airport pick up is a rip off, tuk tuk services are priced very decently (LKR 600 to Hikka and back and LKR 1200 to Galle and back). You will not reach that price when bargaining on the street. 
I must say I am quite disappointed overall as for such a high price for SL I expected something outstanding.
I am returning to Sri Lanka in June but unfortunately not to Aditya. Price is not the question, I am simply looking for better value and better customer care.
title: Bland

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan!

Thank you for your review of Aditya. We are pleased that you enjoyed the service and food, but we regret that you were not entirely satisfied with the overall experience.

In particular, we are sorry that your room and the public areas at Aditya were not up to your expectations.
