text:
We visited "The Golden Ridge Hotel" to organize our Annual Concert, "Butterflies Fly Away 2024". As we know at any hotel there is a welcome drink that is served to any guest. It may be a foreigner, local or an outsider from another city. The front office  people were just chatting to each other, not taking any care of us, maybe as we were from Nuwara Eliya. But, as soon as they saw some buses coming, they were busy with their preparation of welcome drinks for the guests. First of all  customer service is selective and poor, the girls at the reception need to be more respectful, cheerful, helpful and able to cater all guests at the door step. 
We had to wait for some time until our message had gone through to the relevant person, and to come and meet us, as to why we were there. We were met by the Food and Beverage Manager, We told him our requirement, and what we want. But his response was negative.  We wanted a hall to accommodate 60 to 70 guests and 30 kids, for our annual concert, including a buffet after the concert. He mentioned that the hall is not sound proof, There will be  guests in the rooms and it will disturb them, and he wont be able to arrange us the buffet. As it might clash with the in house guests, and wont be able to give us the other restaurant as it will cost us more.  Well management we are there to give you an business after planning with all the expenses, and cost . Its your duty to somehow get the business in and promote your hotel.  We are there to spend and give our parents and kids the experience of a life time.
If the hall is not sound proof better close it down and make it a store room, and from what we know any hotel is there to cater any kind of function and promote themselves to make an income.
But, very unfortunate, The Golden Ridge Hotel has a team which cannot handle the pressure, and just looking  on the rooms and the two restaurants.
We had our function in a star class hotel in Nuwara Eliya, from 2pm to 10 pm, on the 21st of December, 2024, almost spending a staggering amount of Rs.1000000/=. Sad to say that the management or the owner  is not capable  to help and provide the service to the people of Nuwara Eliya.
Think about it, and get closer to the people around you, dont forget the past when businesses were flat and down. With a blink of an eye everything will be gone in the 
wind. Be reasonable, respectful and helpful, every business big or small is important to you now and later.
"Flavorful Destinations" M N Nizam 26th December, 2024.
title: Golden Ridge you let yourself down - Wake Up do your homework

text:
I am currently in the facility and I'm totally disgusted that it is promoted as a five star facility.
Reasons for not considering it 5 star
1. The main building family room has no air-conditioning.  I couldn't sleep the entire night. When I complained the  general manager pushpitha  put it on the agency's head who did the booking. What kind of a facility gets 5 star rating with half of the rooms not having air-conditioning. It's only the mountain chalets which have the air conditioning. The reason given for no air-conditioning is Nuwara eliya is cool and there is heater provided.  So beware when you book. My family could not sleep the entire night and we were provided fans. So it's a 5 star facility with fans.
2. The mini bar is kept empty.  Another criteria for being 5 star is a mini bar stocked up. Here it's empty.
3. Staff at reception and restaurant were rude and without empathy and a lot of arrogance. 
4. In the restaurant I asked for a spoon. The server Sampath gave me one and while handing over remarked you will find more in the restaurant so take it. He then delayed the coffee I asked for just ignoring my request. I then went to Sumu the restaurant supervisor who got me the coffee soon enough. This level of disregard for customer is not acceptable in the 5 star Hotel industry
5. They advertise IpTV with multiple channels. You will actually get 4 or 4 Srilankan channels. Rest you get message as  not subscribed.
I would not recommend this hotel. If you are a seasoned traveller used to 5 star luxury you will certainly find my comments worth your while.

the premium room didn’t even have cookies as in delux room.  When asked the answer - wee are baking ( ha ha even after two hours)

roomTip: Be ready for bugs everywhere
text:
I understand the current situation going on in the Country so I rated higher than what I would have done. 
I actually choose a long vacation in Sri Lanka as I am happy to support a Country that I love and visited many times.

Saying that, the experience at Amaya Lake was kinda disappointing, and very different to the experience I had 4 years ago here.

The welcoming wasn’t warm.
The receptionist didn’t provide clear informations about breakfast and restaurant timings, she was confused and confusing.
The room (bungalow 49) was dirty. Geckos poo, dead insects and dust everywhere, bedsheets included.
Ants were marching literally in every corner of the bungalow. From the bed frame to the bathroom mirror, from the kettle to the mattress. 
I understand the place is in the middle of nature but clearly something was mismanaged in terms of cleanliness routines.
The shower head wasn’t working properly and it was so dirt and clogged that water was sprinkling all over the place, ceiling included. Impossible to take a shower. (But brace yourself, as this turned out not to be the worst part of the shower area)
We called and they changed the shower head. At that point it worked almost fine.
They also realized the ant situation was too bad so they cleaned the room: at that point it was late and we were quite tired.

After some of the issues were somehow rectified I went to the bathroom and found a big frog on the wall. I was a bit surprised and was wondering if all that wildlife was supposed to live in the bungalows… while reflecting on that I noticed a movement with the corner of my eye. I looked behind me and a snake was in the shower. I was shocked. It looked very bad and quite big: black with some yellow rings and stripes and I don’t know why but I felt it wasn’t a harmless one. 
I ran back in the room and immediately called the reception. They arrived only 20 mins later while we were standing on the bed terrified looking at the bathroom where the snake was patrolling around (maybe looking for that frog on the wall?!?)
When staff arrived they actually looked worried as well when they saw the type of snake: they tried to minimize but they were clearly not what they expected …
At that point we were considering to check out but it was 11pm and we were in an isolated place. Far away from anything.
The manager upgraded us to a signature suite.
Now, in all honesty at that point we were not able to appreciate the high standard of the upgraded room (the design and layout was really good for sure) as we were scared to find other surprises. Having no choice we agreed to stay as the room looked newer and overall more “sealed” from the outside wildlife.
Although a premium suite the room presented again many issues clearly due to poor cleaning schedule. Ants were there, balcony/patio constantly infested of geckos poo that was attracting millions of ants.
Also the Jacuzzi bath tube was worn out with loose pieces of metal falling off.

Buffet was ok but expect most of the food quite spicy.

Based on the situation it’s clear that Amaya was closed for so long due to Covid that somehow nature took over the place. That is understandable but a thorough cleaning schedule and staff checking the premises regularly would have fixed the issues. 
It is a premium and expensive hotel so snakes, ants and dirt are not acceptable and this doesn’t have anything to do with the problems Sri Lanka is going through as there is plenty of staff on the premises, it’s just a question of managing resources correctly.
On a final note the receptionists were quite unskilled and so was the staff at the restaurant.
Amaya: organize a good leadership for this place and bring it back to the 5 star resort it should be.
title: A snake and poor maintenance & cleanliness

text:
We visited as a team of three families with kids. We stayed at the signature  division which is the upmarket section.
The rooms were large and very nicely built with all modern amenities. Bathrooms were spacious and clean (at the start) and there is a fairly large closet area which was fantastic. The hotel garden was well maintained and the pools were clean.

Other than that the rest of our two nights stay is awful.
Since we were there in a long weekend and with discounted rates, the hotel was almost full with the overwhelming majority of local travelers.
The resturent was crowded and crampy. The food selection was mediocre with some of the items being served deliberately in small portions.
All the meals we had (5) were the same except for one breakfast which was ok.
The resturent waiters were unhappy,rude and unhelpful. Even the meals we ordered ala-carte were served late and tasted awful.
The biggest disappointment was the rooms. Two out of three rooms we stayed became extremely smelly soon after we checked in. It was probably the bathrooms which did not have functioning ventilator system. Two rooms had the bidet tap fixed on the left side of the toilet. The wash basin looked fancy but very impractical causing spash all over as soon as you open the tap.
All in all, it was apparent that the management had seriously degrades the service level and was on maximum cost cutting mode. It was a shame for such a lovely hotel.
title: Aweful service and food

text:
This hotel is poorly managed and inefficient. I am a Marriott platinum  member and this is easily the worst property I have stayed in on the Indian subcontinent 
 I had problems during my last stay but chose to stay again for 2 nights due to the good location 
At Check in I was promised an upgrade as platinum if I waited an hour which did not transpire even after waiting 2 hours and I was then given an ordinary room No one from management contacted me and there was no attempt at service recovery (when I reported this to Marriott Bonvoy the credited me 3000 points as a nice gesture ) 
Room is small and cramped just one chair for 2 people - poorly designed bathroom where the shower stall leaks 
Breakfast was chaotic and disorganised you couldn’t get a plate of eggs toast bacon and beans without traversing at keast 4 separate stations so at least one item would be cold by the time you secured your breakfast The hoppers were either leathery or burnt - staff were poorly trained and engaged in conversation with each other rather than attending to essential matters ( no salt and pepper on tables, no teaspoon with the coffee etc..) 
To top it all after my stay  I received from a trainee an email request to rate the hotel by but the customary link to do so was missing, clearly an attempt to evade Marriott’s  standards monitoring policy
Two stars for location but the trade off is now unacceptable They  have high occupancy from the low end conference and meeting trade but this will change very quickly if standards are kept low in a city with an excess of hotel rooms.
 For Marriott Bonvoy members there is a much better Sheraton and a more expensive but new ITC luxury collection property For value seekers cinnamon red, the radisson and similar 4 stars offer much better value

text:
Having had bad experiences twice previously I had no intention of visiting the Buffet again. However since there was a Turkish food promotion taking place , I visited the Beira Kitchen and once again it was chaos. We visited at 8.15pm and were assured that food would not run out and would be replenished. Therefore we waited till a table was prepared and commenced our meal at 8.40pm. When we went to serve the main course at 9pm the dishes were already empty. Just gravy in the prawn curry. When you attempt to ask the staff about replenishing they look away. Very limited options. People serving themselves Turkish desserts and eating while standing near the buffet. It was inevitable that the desserts would run out too. We had to serve our mains and desserts at once to ensure we would not be disappointed further.  We finished our mains and still felt hungry as there was only beef, some indian veg items and eggplant which we dont fancy. I then decided to have a soup and there were no bowls. I asked the Manager if I could get a soup bowl to which he frowned and replied "what u want???" . The staff then opened a little cupboard below and started replenishing crockery while I had to stand and wait for him to finish. While waiting for this task to be completed I looked over ad realised that several Turkish sweets had run out and the same available items had been placed in all dishes. 
If you are unable to cater beyond a certain number, please dont accept more reservations than is possible. This is not the first time this has happened and is a norm at this hotel. A buffet should not be on first come first serve basis when all guests are paying the same amount. If you are unable to accept please dont give false assurances and accept. 
When someone posts a review or complains a lovely apology is posted but no action is taken. This hotel just keeps cheating patrons.
title: Turkish Food promotion - no replenishing done

text:
Visited the Beira Kitchen for dinner. This was my second visit. Although we experienced pretty much the same thing on our first visit, we gave them the benefit of the doubt last time as we thought these were teething issues. Apparently not.

I will start with the plus points. The hotel is new and tastefully decorated, the ambience is lovely, the staff is extremely polite, pleasant and courteous. 
Our issue however was with the buffet a at Beira Kitchen which seems to work on first come first serve basis. By 8.15 half the buffet display was empty. Not exaggerating here either. Salad bar almost empty apart from some tomatos and Leafy greens and not replenished. The mains ; grilled fish was just bones and heads. This remained on display and no replenishing done, chillie chicken empty, I'm assuming there were prawns and cuttlefish in the seafood casserole but cannot really be sure as only some small, crushed pieces of fish were remaining. No replenishing was done. I do understand some guests have a habit of picking out certain items but this is foreseeable and therefore unacceptable. Only the Sri lankan and Indian corners had a proper display of food which was rather disappointing. 

The mains however, especially the Indian cuisine was very tasty. maybe the best in Colombo at present. The Sri Lankan cuisine was nice too. Maybe the Western and oriental cuisine was good too but since only the pumpkin mash and boiled vegetables were left it's not possible to comment. 
Desserts need much improvement.

This was the second time this happened. Last time there were no desserts left. 

For a buffet priced at approx. LKR6500/= per person this was a complete waste of money. For an esteemed hotel chain such as Marriot this experience is a complete insult.
title: Extremely Disappointing
